loans.name: Abdurajic

texts.en: Abdurajic A. is from the village of Bantayan. He is 28 years old. Abdurajic is an individual member of PMPC. Abdurajic is married and has one child still in school. To make a living, Abdurajic operates a fish-selling business in the local community. Abdurajic has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. This year, Abdurajic joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Abdurajic is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Abdurajic from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family and to improve his living situation. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell in the community

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: To make a living, Agnes N. owns and operates a restaurant in her community. Her other source of income is from her present job in the local government unit in Sindangan. She is 36 years old, married and has three children. They are from the town of Poblacion, Sindangan. Agnes has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 40,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. This year, Agnes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Agnes is an individual member of PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products for the business. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use additional income to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital to buy ingredients to cook

location.town: Gov. Lim St.,Pob., Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Leorie

texts.en:
Thirty-three-year-old Leorie V. is from the town of Surallah. She is married and has three children. Leorie plants and harvests corn crops that she sells to the market. She also has coconut and banana trees planted on part of her land. A few years ago, she decided to put up a sari-sari (variety) store to help meet her family's daily needs. She sells various products in the store.

Leorie applied for a loan from CEVI, a Kiva partner in the Philippines. She asked for 8,000 Philippines pesos, which she will use to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en: Lorenzo T. is from the town of Surallah. He is 45 years old. Lorenzo is married. To make a living, Lorenzo raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lorenzo also operates a habal-habal (motorcycle transport) service. Lorenzo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorenzo has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lorenzo is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his family financially.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Lory

texts.en:
Lory T. is from the town of Surallah. She is 39 years old, married and has two children, ages 17 and 16. To make a living, Lory raises pigs for fattening and sale. Lory also helps her husband, who is a farmer, plant and harvest corn crops. 

Lory joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lory has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase feed and farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase feed and farm inputs

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: 59-year-old Margarita L. is from the town of Surallah. She is married and has nine children. Two of her children still go to school. Margarita is engaged in farming. She plants and harvests rice crops to sell at the market. She also raises chickens and runs a sari-sari store. Margarita does all these activities to provide for her family. Margarita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Margarita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor T. is from the town of Surallah. He is 47 years old. Nestor is married and has a 9-year-old child. To make a living, Nestor raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nestor works hard to have a stable business so he can provide for his family's needs.

Nestor joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nestor has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Nestor is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand it.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ricarido

texts.en:
Ricarido D. is from the town of Surallah. He is 61 years old. Ricarido is married and has four children, aged 23, 22, 20 and 16. To make a living, Ricarido raises pigs for fattening and sale. Ricarido also plants and harvests corn crops. 

Ricarido joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ricarido is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to buy feeds and farm inputs. This loan will help Ricarido improve his harvest.

loans.use: To buy feeds and farm inputs

loans.name: Roquita

texts.en:
Roquita V. is from the town of Surallah. She is married and has six children. Roquita plants and harvests corn crops that she sells to the market. She also has coconut trees, as well mangoes and bananas, planted on part of her land. She also sells her fruit harvest. Aside from farming, Roquita also runs a small sari-sari (variety) store where she sells detergent, soap and other various products.

Roquita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roquita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Roquita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Willa

texts.en:
Willa G. is from the town of Surallah. She is 55 years old. Willa is married and has four children, aged 23, 20, 17 and 13. To make a living, Willa raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Willa also has a backyard piggery, where she fattens pigs.

Willa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Willa has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Willa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to buy farm inputs and feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and feeds

loans.name: Plok

texts.en:
Plok S., 49, is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a water pipe to use for growing vegetables. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. 

S. is a housewife. S. is married and resides with her husband and five children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, an area known for being well-supplied with freshwater from major rivers. 

The family has to spend $40 on food, $2 on electricity supply and $24 on other necessary expenses every month. Her three children are employed at the factory, earning an income of about $2 each per day to help cover the family expenses.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a water pipe to use for growing vegetables

loans.name: Seoum

texts.en:
Seoum M., 56, is a farmer, earning an income of $2 per day. M. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple. 

The family has to spend $37.50 on food, $5 on electricity supply and $15 on other necessary expenses every month. One of her children is employed, earning an income of about $10 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

M. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for the child to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the child to commute to work

loans.name: Khen

texts.en:
Khen N., 41, is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a machine to improve his furniture business. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. 

N. produces wooden furniture to sell, earning a gross income of $30 per day. N. is married and resides with his wife and two children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. 

The family has to spend $66 on food, $20 on electricity supply, and $33 on other necessary expenses every month.  

This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a machine to improve the furniture business

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men K., 36, sells groceries, earning an income of $6.30 per day. K. is married and resides with her husband and a child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple. 

The family has to spend $23.80 on food, $3.70 on electricity supply and $22.50 on other necessary expenses every month. 

K. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Pring

texts.en:
Pring Y., 40, sells groceries, earning an income of $3 per day. Y. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of $2 per day. 

The family has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity supply and $50 on other necessary expenses every month. 

Y. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Teat

texts.en:
Teat T., 42, produces hand-made brooms to sell, earning an income of $1 per day. T. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a railway worker, earning an income of $4 per day. 

The family has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity supply and $45 on other necessary expenses every month. 

T. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase platinum for one of her children to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy platinum for her child to sell

loans.name: Chek

texts.en:
Chek T., 59, sells groceries, earning an income of $3 per day. T. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of $1 per day. 

The family has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity supply and $40 on other necessary expenses every month. 

T. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a car for one of her children to start a business as a taxi driver. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. T. appears in the photograph while she is doing her housework.

loans.use: To buy a car for her child to start a business

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um L., 38, sells hand-made baskets, earning an income of $2.60 per day. L. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of $2 per day. 

The family has to spend $55 on food, $10 on electricity supply and $100 on other necessary expenses every month. 

L. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more baskets and cows to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more baskets and cows to resell

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem K., 34, sells hand-made brooms, earning an income of $4 per day. K. is married and resides with his wife and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. 

The family has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity supply, and $55 on other necessary expenses every month. 

K. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase palm sugar to stock for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. K. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: To buy palm sugar to stock for sale

loans.name: Tsereenjav

texts.en: Tsereenjav N. is 28 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in the Uvs province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, wihtin his brother's fence. Tseveenjav and his wife both operate a taxi service in their town using their own car. He began his taxi business after working and living as a herder in the countryside for several years. Today, their daily business earnings exceed 25,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). For the future, he plans to sell his small car and buy a larger truck at 2,000,000 MNT with 1.5 tons of capacity in order to start operating a transportation business to increase his profits. He has used his earnings to improve his family's standard of living. Tseveenjav is a modest man and says, "I plan to pay off this loan fully on time and buy my own plot of land and fence for my family." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan for half of the vehicle's price in order to purchase a truck.

loans.use: To purchase a truck

loans.name: Silvard

texts.en:
Silvard M. is 51 years old and lives in Sevan city. She is married and has three daughters, two of whom are already married and live separately from their parents, and the third of whom helps Silvard in the family business.
Silvard, her husband and her daughter run a food and household goods trading business to provide for all their needs. Silvard buys merchandise from suppliers and sells them in her private shop. Her daughter helps her in the shop and her husband finds new suppliers. This is Silvard’s second Kiva loan. With her first loan, she was able to organize her household goods trading shop. Now Silvard is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 AMD to buy a New Year’s assortment of candy, beverages and New Year’s decorations to resell.

loans.use: To buy a New Year’s assortment of candy, beverages and New Year’s decorations to resell

loans.name: Pok

texts.en: Pok K. is 22 years old and lives with her husband and young child in Takeo province. She is able to make about $5 USD profit a day, selling groceries, while her husband is a professional traditional singer, typically making $3 USD per day. Pok K. is asking for a loan of $700 USD to add to her grocery inventory.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Francis Waithaka

texts.en:
Francis, age 39, is married to Sophia who is a farmer.  Together they have four children aged seven, nine, 13 and 17 years old. He is a farmer dealing with both animal sales and crop farming. He buys sheep and feeds them with the intention of selling them later at a profit. Most people buy sheep for their meat as well as for the wool. Therefore, this is a profitable venture. 

Francis was introduced to Kiva partner KADET LTD by a friend. Francis has been running this business for 12 years and he finds it profitable.This is the first loan he is getting from KADET and he intends to buy a dairy cow to suppliment the family income. 

If the loan improves the business, he will use the proceeds to expand his trade and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen P. is from the town of Banga. She is 48 years old, married and has seven children. Her eldest child is 23 years old and the youngest is only 5. To make a living, Aileen owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Aileen wishes to have all her children finish college and have bright futures.
Aileen joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Aileen is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Paiy

texts.en: Paiy S., 30, is a professional silk weaver, making $2 USD each day in Takeo province. She is married and supports two children living at home. Her husband, Phen Phon, makes approximately $3 USD every day, selling cows. Paiy S. would like a loan of $900 USD to purchase more silk.

loans.use: To purchase more silk

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli T. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has five children. To make a living, Arceli owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting corn for sale. Arceli also grows hogs for fattening and sale.
Arceli joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Arceli is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to buy farm inputs, piglets and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs, piglets and feed

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia L. is from the town of Banga. She is 41 years old, married and has five children. Her eldest child is 20 years old and the youngest is 10. All of her children go to school. To make a living, Cresencia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising ducks to produce and sell eggs. Cresencia also plants and harvests corn crops. She sells her harvest to the market.
Cresencia joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Cresencia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to buy feed and farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To buy feed and farm inputs

loans.name: Dzigbodi Akossiwa

texts.fr: Mme Akossiwa  a 4 enfants et est mariée à un agent de douane. Pour contribuer au ménage, elle fait  la vente de charbons de bois. Elle a commencé en  1990 cette activité et s’approvisionne à Anié. Elle revend ensuite les charbons à la devanture de sa maison. Elle est dans son troisième cycle de prêt. Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 25 nouveaux sacs de charbons.
texts.en: Mrs Akossiwa has four children and is married to a customs officer. To contribute towards household expenses, she sells charcoal. She began this activity in 1990 and gets her supplies in Anié. Then she resells the charcoal in front of her home. This is her third loan cycle. She applies for this loan to buy 25 new sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Dionalin

texts.en:
Dionalin P. is from the town of Banga. She is 41 years old, married and has two children aged 12 and 15. To make a living, Dionalin owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Dionalin has been engaged in farming for over 10 years and she earns approximately 3,500 PHP per month.
Dionalin joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Dionalin is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Elwarth

texts.en:
Elwarth T. is from the town of Banga. He is married. To make a living, Elwarth owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting corn for sale. Elwarth wants to be able to provide for all his family's needs. He hopes his business will become stable.
Elwarth joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Elwarth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase herbicides and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides and fertilizers

loans.name: Ayanou

texts.fr: M. K.  a 39 ans  et est marié. Il a en charge  3 enfants. Il est né à Ahépé et habite  quartier Adidogomé.  Il   fait le commerce de produits congelés et cumule déjà  5 ans. Il s’approvisionne à Togo frigo et revend les produits dans une boutique devant son domicile mais il n’a pas de stocks. Il compte acheter 6 cartons de Sardinelles, 12 cartons de chinchards et 4 cartons de Tilapias.
texts.en: Mr K., aged 39, is married. He cares for three children. He was born in Ahépé and lives now in the neighborhood of Adidogomé. He sells frozen foods and has a five-year experience in this trade. He gets his supplies from the company Togo Frigo and resells them in his store in front of his home. But he ran out of inventory. He intends to buy 6 boxes of sardinella, 12 boxes of chinchard and 4 boxes of tilapia.

loans.use: To buy frozen foods

loans.name: Dakiétou

texts.fr: Mme Dakiétou a 2 enfants et est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur de profession. Elle fait le commerce  de céréales mais elle n’a pas présentement de stocks. Elle compte 9 ans dans cette activité et achète les stocks de maïs à Anié. Elle revend ensuite au marché local de Totsi.  L’objet de ce crédit sera essentiellement destiné à l’achat de 10 sacs de maïs, 4 sacs d’haricot et  6 sacs de mil.
texts.en: Mrs Dakiétou, aged 41, is the mother of two children. She is married to a professional driver. She has a cereals business, but right now her inventory is depleted. She has been in this activity for 9 years. She buys her corn supplies in Anié. Then she resells them at the local market in Totsi. She will use this loan essentially to buy 10 sacks of corn, 4 sacks of beans and 6 sacks of millet.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Jagvaral

texts.en:
Ms. Jagvaral is 27 years old and lives with her mother, younger brother and sister in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Together they live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger housing districts of the city. In 2007, Ms. Jagvaral graduated from the Mongolian State University of Agriculture with a concentration in food engineering and technology. Ms. Jagvaral’s brother is a secondary school student and her sister is a cook for a local construction company. Her mother is retired and stays at home.

Ms. Jagvaral is in charge of operating the small food store in her family’s yard with regular help from her mother.  The food store is in a small wooden cabin that must be kept warm by constantly keeping a fire burning in the winter. Currently, the food store sells mainly vegetables to neighbors in the surrounding ger district. With this loan of 1,500,000 MNT, Ms. Jagvaral’s family wants to expand their food store to sell a constant variety of foods beyond vegetables, such as flour, meat, rice, and candy. 

In the future, Ms. Jagvaral wants to expand the store’s size. Also, she wants to build a permanent brick house for her family in their current yard.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of food products to sell in the grocery store

loans.name: Usuhgerel

texts.en:
Usuhgerel J. is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Zavhan province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. Both her two daughters attend a local secondary school.
Usuhgerel and her husband operate a raw material retail business in their town. She began her business in 2002 by operating a livestock and meat trading business. After many years of operation, she has gained a lot of experience as a businesswoman. Usuhgerel and her husband purchase raw materials from herders in the countryside and sells those products for a profit at the central market.
Usuhgerel is a diligent and honest woman. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more raw materials from herders.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Purevjav

texts.en:
Mr. Purevjav is 24 years old and lives with his wife, daughter and two sisters-in-law in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since his family does not have their own housing yet, they live together in his sisters-in-law's apartment.  His daughter is 1 year old and stays at home with his wife's younger sister.  His wife works in the marketing department of a local company.  

Previously, Mr. Purevjav worked at a wood factory in Khentii province before he moved to Ulaanbaatar. In 2008, he moved to Ulaanbaatar and began his small mobile phone retail business with only 2 million MNT, when the Tedy-3, a mobile phone market, was established.  At his stall, he sells mobile phones to local residents.  Today, his working capital has increased to 6 million MNT.

Mr. Purevjav is naturally hardworking and known to be friendly to his customers.  Compared to the other stalls around him at the market, Mr. Purevjav's mobile phones are better quality. He also sells a wider variety of mobile phone model choices.  

He has been successfully expanding his business and was able to improve his living condition gradually.  He said, "I want to grow my business with this loan. I would like to be able to buy my own house in the future." In order to increase his mobile phone variety for his customers, Mr. Purevjav is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan.

loans.use: To purchase a wider variety of mobile phones

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Narantuya is 46 years old and lives with her husband and 2 daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family does not own their apartment yet, but they have a mortgage loan from another bank in order to eventually own it.  She has been on schedule with her mortgage loan payments to date. It is her family’s goal to one day own their apartment. 

Mrs. Narantuya’s husband works as an engineer at Naran Tuul Trade and her oldest daughter is a teller at a Mongolian bank. Mrs. Narantuya supports her family by operating a beauty salon. Her youngest daughter helps her mother at the salon by giving manicures and pedicures to customers. Other services that Mrs. Narantuya’s family salon offers are body and head massages, facial treatments, and eyebrow tattoos. 

When she began her business in 2001, Mrs. Narantuya’s salon was in a small space with only one massage bed. Since that time, her salon has expanded to three massage beds with a variety of other services in a larger space than before. Recently, the salon has had an average of twenty customers per day. 

With this loan of 1,200,000 MNT, Mrs. Narantuya will purchase beautician equipment which can remove freckles and tattoos and clean facial skin. The loan will hopefully allow her to expand her service offerings and give higher quality services with better equipment than she currently owns. The salon’s extra earnings will go towards her family’s expenses and reaching her family’s goal of being secure in their own apartment.

loans.use: To purchase beautician equipment which can remove freckles and tattoos and clean facial skin

loans.name: Mèla Pèla

texts.fr: Mlle Pèla a un enfant en charge et est âgée de 31 ans. Elle fait le commerce de friperie pour pouvoir s’occuper de son enfant. Elle a commencé en 2008 cette activité et s’approvisionne au marché local de Hedzranawoé en gros et redistribue en détail.  Elle est née à Lomé et habite quartier  Novissi. Elle espère acheter  avec le nouveau crédit  5 balles de friperie.
texts.en: Miss Pèla, aged 31, cares for one child. She sells second-hand clothes to be able to provide for her child. She began this activity in 2008. She buys her supplies wholesale at the local market in Hedzranawoé and then sells them retail. She was born in Lomé and lives now in the neighborhood of Novissi. She hopes to buy 5 bales of second-hand clothes with the proceeds of the new loan.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes

loans.name: Zipora  Wanzila

texts.en:
Zipora Wanzilu K. is 42 years old and the single mother of four school going children .She has been selling clothes in Mlolongo Market and operating rental houses for 10 years. She earns a profit of Kshs 10,000 per month.

She was introduced to Kiva partner KADET LTD by KADET staff, and she is applying for her second loan of Kshs.60, 000 after paying back the previous loan successfully. Zipora plans to use the loan as follows: Kshs. 30,000 to purchase more clothes to sell during the festive season, and Kshs 30,000 to renovate the rental houses.

She will use the extra income generated to open a boutique in Kitengela. She desires to grow her business and own a wholesale shop for clothes in Mlolongo Market Centre in the future. Zipora describes herself as outgoing and ready to grow in business.

loans.use: To buy clothes and renovate rental houses.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter M. is 40 years, married to Mbatha and together they have four children age between 17 years to five years .He has been selling clothes and shoes for the last two years and earns a profit of Kshs.10, 000 per month, in Mlolongo market which is a very busy market.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a Credit officer and he is applying for his first loan of Kshs.20, 000, which he plans to use the whole amount to buy more clothes and shoes for sale in this festive season. He has no history with any other MFI.

The anticipated profit he plans to save and buy a pickup which he will use to sell clothes and shoes from and also for hiring. Peter hopes to grow his business and become a prominent business man in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes worth Kshs.10,000 and shoes worth Kshs. 10,000 for sale

loans.name: Lentoyian  Kasana

texts.en:
Lentoyien Kasana P. has been in livestock trading for 10 years in Bissil market in Kajiado which is a very busy market and most of his customers are also livestock traders. She earns a profit of Kshs.4, 000 per month.

She is 56 years, married to Saibulu Kasana 60 years old. Lentoyien was introduced to KADET LTD by World vision staff, and has no history with any other MFI. She is applying for first loan of Kshs.50,000 which she intends to use the whole amount to purchase  livestock that is sheep and goats to rear and sell in the festive season.

The anticipated profit she will use to start transporting meat to Kenya Meat Commission, and in the future she desires to become a prominent business person. She describes herself as outgoing lady

loans.use: To buy livestock like sheep and goats to rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est composé de cinq femmes mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages monogames, avec en moyenne 34 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent dans le village de Cinzana Gare, chef lieu d’une commune rurale dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’igname, de poissons fumés, de sésame et de pagnes wax. 
Dans le besoin d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Binta  Traoré qui est un des membres du groupe, ayant une très grande renommée dans le ravitaillement de la population de Cinzana Gare en igname, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 7 sacs d’igname à Koutiala auprès des producteurs. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit, parfois à domicile et au marché de Cinzana Gare à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Madame Binta  Traoré espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. 
Elle a pour objectif d’entretenir ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin de devenir grossiste dans cette activité.
texts.en:
Benkadi Group ("Harmony") is composed of five married women. Most of them live in monogamous households. On average, they are 34 years old and have two children. They live in the village of Cinzana Gare, the county town of a rural municipality in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other through ties of neighborhood and kinship.

The group members trade with yams, smoked fish, sesame and wax pagnes (colorful African cloth). Faced with the need to increase their working capital, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first solidarity loan.

Mrs Binta Traoré, one of the group members, has an outstanding record of providing yams to the population of Cinzana Gare. She intends to use her loan to buy 7 sacks of yams from producers in Koutiala. She retails the yams from her home or at the market in Cinzana Gare, for cash and credit, to a clientele made up of women and men.

Mrs Binta Traoré expects to make a monthly profit of 25,000 CFA francs which she will reinvest in her business. Her goal is to stay in her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso and thus become a wholesaler in her sector.

loans.use: To buy yams

loans.name: Radik

texts.en:
Radik M. is 24 years old and lives in Ijevan city. A month ago he got married and now he lives with his parents and his wife, who is jobless. Radik graduated from Ijevan state college's motor transport department, so he has a good knowledge of vehicles. He now works as a taxi driver. He works without free days and already has permanent customers. With his business income, Radik support his family. He has also been able to buy furniture for his house and organize his wedding.
Radik says that during Christmas and New Year's holidays his taxi service is in popular demand. Therefore, he is asking for a loan of 370,000 AMD to buy winter tire casings, a new accumulator, motor oil and antifreeze and to do some repair work on his car.

loans.use: To buy winter tire casings, new accumulator, motor oil and antifreeze and to do some repair work on his car

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Danaya sont mariés majoritairement  dans des ménages polygames avec en moyenne 45 ans et 5 enfants par femme. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Cinzana Gare, chef lieu d’une commune rurale dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et de parenté. 
Les membres du groupe font le commerce de condiments (boites de concentrée de tomate, poudre de gombo et de feuilles de baobab), de pastèques, d’habits et de boissons locales. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Oumou Sidibé, qui est la présidente du groupe, est une grande vendeuse de boites de concentrées de tomate à Cinzana Gare. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 cartons de boites de concentrée de tomate à Koutiala en gros. Elle effectue sa vente  au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché de Cinzana Gare à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes. 
Madame Oumou Sidibé espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour assurer les soins de santé des enfants. 
Elle a pour objectif à l’instar des autres membres du groupe de réinvestir dans l’activité afin d’augmenter son volume.
texts.en:
The six members of Danaya Group ("Confidence") are married women. Most of them live in polygamous households. On average, they are 45 years old and have five children. They live in the village of Cinzana Gare, the county town of a rural municipality in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other through ties of marriage and kinship.

The group members trade with food condiments (cans of tomato purée, okra powder and baobab leaves), watermelons, clothes and local drinks. Faced with the need to increase their working capital, the group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their third cycle of solidarity loans.

Mrs Oumou Sidibé, the chairwoman of the group, is a great seller of cans of tomato purée in Cinzana Gare. She intends to use her loan to buy wholesale 10 boxes of cans of tomato purée in Koutiala. She retails them from her home or at the market in Cinzana Gare, for cash and credit, to a clientele made up mostly of women.

Mrs Oumou Sidibé expects, thanks to this loan, to make a monthly profit of 35,000 CFA francs which she will use to pay for health services for her children. Her goal, like her fellow group members' goal, is to reinvest in her activity to increase her turnover.

loans.use: To buy cans of tomato purée

loans.name: Horonya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Horonya sont mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages monogames. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 3 enfants et habitent ensemble dans le village de Cinzana Gare, chef lieu d’une commune rurale dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. 
Les membres du groupe font le commerce de parures, de laits, d’ustensiles plastiques et de pochettes. 
Dans le besoin d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, elles sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt.
 Madame Tata   Saré  est beaucoup sollicitée à Cinzana Gare pour sa vente d’ustensiles en plastiques de toutes sortes (pots, bols, assiettes, bassines, etc) surtout pendant les périodes de mariage. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 20 douzaines d’ustensiles en plastique composées de: pots, bols et assiettes. Elle se ravitaille au grand marché de Ségou et effectue sa vente au comptant et à crédit, à domicile, au marché de Cinzana Gare et dans les villages environnants à une clientèle composée de femmes et parfois d’hommes. 
Madame Tata   Saré espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins de condiments du foyer. 
Elle a pour objectif de s’investir dans l’élevage des petits ruminants dans le futur.
texts.en:
The four members of Horonya Group are married women. Most of them live in monogamous households. On average, they are 33 years old and have three children. They all live in the village of Cinzana Gare, the county town of a rural municipality in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other through ties of neighborhood and kinship.

The group members trade with fancy jewels, milk, plastic utensils and small handbags. Faced with the need to increase their working capital, the group members decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their fourth cycle of solidarity loans.

Mrs Tata Saré sells all kinds of plastic utensils (pots, bowls, plates, basins, etc.) which are in high demand in Cinzana Gare, especially during wedding periods. She intends to use her loan to buy 20 dozens of sets of plastic utensils: pots, bowls and plates. She gets her supplies at the great market in Ségou and retails them from her home, at the market in Cinzana Gare and in the neighboring villages, for cash and credit, to a clientele made up women and sometimes men.

Mrs Tata Saré expects, thanks to this loan, to make an average profit of 40,000 CFA francs a month, which she will use to reinvest in her business and provide her family with food. Her goal for the future is to invest in rearing small ruminants.

loans.use: To buy plastic utensils

loans.name: Munhjargal

texts.en: Munhjargal D. is a 25-year-old woman who lives with her parents in Hovd province, Mongolia. She has a sick mother who is confined to bed and a father who is not working. Munhjargal operates a café business and has worked in her rented café in town since 2009. Before this, she was working in her sister's café, so she has a lot of experience. Munhjargal is a friendly and hardworking woman. She has good family relationships even though her standard of living is poor. In the future she hopes to have her own restaurant and be able to help her parents. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to buy a refrigerator and dishes for her café.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and dishes for her café

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Sabougnouman sont mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages polygames ayant en moyenne 43 ans, 5 enfants et habitant ensemble dans le village de Cinzana Gare chef lieu d’une commune rurale dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. 
Les membres du groupe font le commerce de draps de lit, de couvre lits et de condiments alimentaires (Sounbala, poudre de gombo, de piments, etc). 
Dans le souci d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Sitan S. est beaucoup sollicité à Cinzana Gare pour la vente des draps pendant les 12 mois de l’année. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter trente draps en gros au grand marché de Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit, à domicile, au marché de Cinzana Gare et dans les villages environnants à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Madame Sitan S. espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins de condiments du foyer. 
Elle a pour objectif de s’investir dans l’élevage des petits ruminants dans le futur.
texts.en:
The seven women of  the Sabougnouman group are mostly married in polygamous families. They have an average age of 43 and five children, and live together in the village of Cinzana Gare, capital of a rural province in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know one another through ties of neighborhood, marriage and family.
Group members are trading bed sheets, bed coverings and spices (Sounbala powder, curry, pepper, etc.).
In order to improve their business, the members of this group have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fourth round of loan.
Ms. Sitan S. faces a large demand of bed sheets in Cinzana Gare during the 12 months of the year.
She intends to use her loan to buy thirty sheets at the general wholesale market in Ségou. Resale is made in cash or credit, at home, at the market of Cinzana and in the surrounding villages, to a clientele made mainly of women. 
With this loan Ms. Sitan S. hopes to achieve an average monthly profit of 40 000Fcfa to be reinvested in the business and to respond to the demand of spices in their neighborhood. In the future she would like to invest in the husbandry of small animals.

loans.use: Purchase of bed bed sheets

loans.name: Saniya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Saniya sont mariées majoritairement  dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 26 ans et 2 enfants par femme. Elles habitent ensemble dans le village de Cinzana Gare chef lieu d’une commune rurale dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le petit commerce de tubercules (pomme de terre, patate et igname), jus locaux, foulards et boissons locales. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Marama Traoré est connue à Cinzana Gare pour sa vente de tubercules au bord de la route nationale N° 6. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 sacs de patates et de pommes de terre en gros à Koutiala avec les producteurs. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et à sa place de vente au bord du goudron à Cinzana Gare à une clientèle mixte. 
Madame Marama Traoré espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins de condiments du foyer. 
Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité tout comme les autres membres de son groupe dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The women of the group Saniya are married for the most part in monogamous families.  They average 26 years of age and two children per woman.  They live together in the village of Cinzana Gare, the seat of the rural commune, in the region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members know one another through ties of kinship, and they have small-scale businesses involving tubers (potatoes, sweet potatoes, and yams), local fruit juices, scarves, and local beverages.  

Concerned about increasing their working capital, the group members joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan cycle.  

Ms. Marama Traoré is known in Cinzana Gare for selling tubers on the roadside of National Road N° 6. She plans on using her loan to buy 10 sacks of potatoes and sweet potatoes wholesale from producers in Koutiala. The goods are resold out of the home and at her spot along the asphalt in Cinzana Gare.  Her customer base is varied.

Ms. Marama Traoré hopes to use this loan to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and for meeting the food needs at home. Her goal is to increase her business volume, just like the other group members in this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: Buying tubers (potatoes)

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI sont  toutes mariés ayant en moyenne 41  ans, 4 enfants et vivant majoritairement dans des  familles polygames à MEDINE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur huitième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été remboursés dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments  tel  le cas de AWA S., la présidente du groupe. 
AWA S.  compte acheter avec son  prêt  10 paniers de tomates. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso.
Les paniers de tomates  sont revendus au  marché de MEDINE à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille .
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The members of the group BENKADI are married, averaging 41 years of age and four children living for the most part in polygamous families in MEDINE, a district of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members are on their eighth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers.  The past loans have been repaid properly. This group of women does commerce in condiments, as in the case of Ms. AWA S., the group’s president.  

AWA S. plans on using her loan to buy 1 baskets of tomatoes.  She gets her supplies at the big market of Sikasso.  The tomatoes are sold for cash to a customer base composed of women at the MEDINE market in Sikasso together as a family.  She envisions making an average monthly profit of 70,000 francs CFA that will be used for day-to-day family expenses.  She has the ambition of increasing her sales in order to satisfy her customer base.

loans.use: Buying tomatoes

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe CONFIANCE sont essentiellement des  femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans  et 2 enfants. Elles  vivent  dans des familles monogames à OUAYERMA I  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur douzième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.  Tous les prêts précédents ont été  bien soldés. Elles font la vente de condiments et de la restauration.  KADI S. qui est la présidente du groupe excelle dans l’achat vente des condiments alimentaires.  
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 15 colis de condiments.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Sikasso.
Elle vend à domicile et dans  les villages voisins, au comptant  souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 48.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group CONFIANCE are essentially married women averaging 35 years of age and two children.  They lives in monogamous families in OUAYERMA I, a district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members are on their twelfth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers.  All the previous loans have been settled. The women of the group sell condiments, and they work in food service.  

KADI S., who is the group’s president, excels in buying and selling condiments for cooking.  With her new loan, she is planning to buy 15 packs of condiments.  She gets her supplies at the big market of Sikasso.  Accepting cash and often credit from a customer base composed of men and women, she sells out of her home and in neighboring village.  KADI envisions making an average monthly profit of 48,500 francs CFA.  Part of the profits will be put into savings and used to meet family needs.  The other part will be invested in her business.

loans.use: Buying condiments for cooking

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe DANAYA sont essentiellement des  femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à OUAYERMA I  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur huitième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts précédents ont été  bien soldés. Elles font essentiellement la vente de pagnes et  de tissus tel avec KADIA K.
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 15 balles de tissus au grand marché  de Sikasso auprès des grossistes. Elle vend au marché de  Sikasso et à domicile au comptant,  souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 42.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of this DANAYA group are mostly married women with an average age of 37 and 3 children, on average. Most of them live in monogamous families in OUAYERMA I, a neighborhood of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 
 
They are on their eighth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, aiming to satisfy the needs of their clientele. Their preceding loans were repaid correctly. They mostly sell "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African cloth used for clothing) and other fabrics, as does Kadia K.. 

With her new loan, she is intending to buy 15 bales of cloth from wholesalers in the big marketplace in Sikasso. She resells them in the market in Sikasso and out of her home, for cash and often on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She expects to make an average monthly profit of  42.500 FCFA, part of which she will put aside as savings and for family necessities, investing the rest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth

loans.name: Purevjargal

texts.en:
Purevjargal Y. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent and fence. His oldest two children both attend a local high school and his third child is in a kindergarten while his wife stays at home and takes care of their infant son. His wife also makes a variety of breads and pastries at home and sells them through local grocery shops to supplement the family's income.
Purevjargal operates a small wooden products production business in his town. He has been engaged in this business for the past three years and has gained significant experience over the years. Yet he has not expanded his business into a stable operation due to insufficient working capital. Purevjargal is a responsible and honest man who works very hard to provide for his family. He is requesting a 100,000 MNT loan for use as working capital.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
AWA S. est une femme mariée de plus 54 ans et mère de 7 enfants qui vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Nimbougou, un des  village de la sous préfecture de Loulouni (préfecture de Kadiolo, troisième région du Mali).
AWA S. mène cette activité d’achat et vente de produits pharmaceutiques il y a dix ans. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout en hivernage, mais ses ressources ne peuvent pas lui permettre de les satisfaire. Ainsi, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est son sixième prêt individuel, pour acheter 18 cartons de produits pharmaceutiques à  Sikasso  afin de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroitre.
Ses marchandises sont vendues à domicile et  à la maternité de Nimbougou.  
Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus cinq ans. Elle a déjà bénéficié de deux  prêts agricoles avec une association des femmes de son village et est maintenant à son quatrième prêt individuel; tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utiliser pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
AWA S. is a married woman, more than 54 years old and the mother of seven children, who lives with her husband and their children in Nimbougou, one of the villages of the district of Loulouni (Préfecture of Kadiolo, third region of Mali).

AWA S. has been buying and selling pharmaceutical products for 10 years. She has an excellent reputation in this business and gets a lot of orders, especially during the rainy season, but her working capital does not permit her to satisfy her customers' needs. Thus she has come to Soro Yiriwaso with whom she is on her sixth loan, to buy 18 boxes of pharmaceutical products in Sikasso so that she can satisfy the needs of her ever-growing customer base. Her merchandise is sold out of her home and in the birthing clinic in Nimbougou.  

She has been working with Soro Yiriwaso for more than five years. She already received two agricultural loans with a group of women from her village and she is now  on her fourth individual loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. 

With this loan she expects to make a monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA which will be used to help cover family expenses and pay the interest on her loan, and she will reinvest any remainder in her business.

loans.use: buying pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe DANAYA sont mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 40  ans et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogames à MEDINE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur onzième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passé ont été remboursés dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de tissus  avec FATOUMATA T., la restauration, les boissons non alcoolisées etc . 
FATOUMATA T.  compte acheter avec son  prêt  50 pagnes de tissus wax. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso et à Bamako (capitale du Mali) . Les pagnes  wax sont revendus au  marché de MEDINE à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of this DANAYA group are married and have an average age of 40 with, on average, three children. They live in monogamous families in Medine, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 

They are on their eleventh loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, aimed at satisfying their clientele. Their previous loans were reimbursed in a timely manner. This group of women sell cloth, as does Fatoumata T., or sell cooked foods, non-alcoholic drinks, etc. 

FATOUMATA T.  intends to buy 50 lengths of good quality African print cloth ("pagnes") with her loan. She does her buying at the big marketplace in Sikasso and in Bamako (the capital of Mali). The lengths of cloth are resold at the markets of Medine, Sikasso, and to family members, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash. 

She expects to make a monthly profit of 90,000 F CFA which will be used for the day-to-day expenses of her family.

loans.use: purchasing cloth

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe JIGUISSEME sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles  vivent la dans des familles monogames à OUAYERMA II  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur sixième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts précédents ont été  bien soldés. Elles font la vente de savon liquide, de pagnes, de tissus et de la friperie  avec AWA K.. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 10 balles de friperies.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Sikasso et effectue sa vente à domicile et au marché au comptant souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 49.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Jiguisseme group are mostly married women, averaging 32 years old with 3 children. They live in monogamous families in Ouayerma II, one of the neighborhoods of Sikasso, third administrative district of Mali. 

They are on their 3rd loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet their customers' needs. The previous loans have been properly repaid. The women sell liquid soap, "pagne" fabric, other fabric and used clothing with Awa K.. With her new loan, Awa plans to buy 10 bales of used clothing. She obtains her supplies at the grand market in Sikasso and sells at her house and at the market for cash, and often for credit, to customers who are both men and women. She expects to make a monthly profit of 49,000 CFA francs, of which some will be used for savings and the family's needs, the rest being re-invested in her business.

loans.use: To buy used clothes

loans.name: Soro Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Soro Yiriwa sont essentiellement des  femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 2 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à OUAYERMA I  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur sixième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Tous les prêts précédents ont été  bien soldés. Elles font la vente, de pagnes wax, des tissus teintés, du savon liquide et de la friperie avec  ASTAN K.. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 10 balles de friperies.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Sikasso. Elle vend à domicile et au marché au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 47.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en: The members of the group Soro Yiriwa are essentially married women averaging 35 years of age and two children living for the most part in monogamous families in OUAYERMA I, a district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members are on their sixth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers. The previous loans have all been settled.   The group members sell wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), dyed cloth, liquid soap, and second-hand clothing, as is the case with Ms. YOUMA K..  With her new loan, YOUMA is planning to buying 10 bales of second-hand clothing.  She gets her supplies at the big market of Sikasso.  Accepting cash and credit from a customer base composed of men and women, she makes her sales out of her home and at the market. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 47,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits will be put into savings and used for meeting family needs. The other part will be invested in her business.

loans.use: Buying used clothing

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Badenya sont essentiellement des  femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 3 enfants et qui  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à MAMASSONI  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur huitième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Les prêts précédents ont été  bien soldés. Elles font la vente de fruits et légumes  avec YOUMA K., la restauration, etc. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, YOUMA compte acheter, 10 paniers de fruits et légumes.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de SIKASSO.
Elle vend à domicile, au marché de Sikasso et dans les villages voisins, au comptant souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle compte avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The members of the group Badenya are essentially married women averaging 36 years of age and three children living in monogamous families in MAMASSONI, a district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members are on their eighth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers.  The previous loans have all been settled.  

The group members sell fruit and vegetables, as is the case with Ms. YOUMA K., and they are active in food service, etc.  With her loans YOUMA plans on buying 10 baskets of fruit and vegetables.  She gets her supplies at the big market of Sikasso.  Accepting cash and often credit from a customer base composed of men and women, she makes her sales out of her home, at the Sikasso market, and in neighboring villages.  

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 37,500 francs CFA. Part of the profits will be put into savings and used for meeting family needs. The other part will be invested in her business.  She is counting on having more capital in order to satisfy her customers further.

loans.use: Buying fruit

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is 36 years old, married and blessed with four children, who are all in school. He owns a lorry which he uses for transport. He has employed two people in his business. Since Richard joined Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business.  He dreams of buying more vehicles in the future. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy tires and insure his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy tires and insure his lorry

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen B. is 38 years-old and he lives in Ijevan city. Armen is married and has three children: two school aged daughters and a two year-old son.
 
His wife stays at home and takes care of their children, while Armen runs a fruit and vegetable shop. With his business incomes Armen was able to buy a van and now he delivers fruits and vegetables from Yerevan, different villages of Armenia and even from Georgia. He sells his merchandise from his van or from tables and boxes on the street. 

Thanks to his business incomes he meets his family’s needs and has bought necessary furniture for their house. 

Armen is asking for a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams to buy a large lot of citrus fruits (especially mandarins) and vegetables for his business.

loans.use: To buy citrus fruits (especially mandarins) and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Gnetaga Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe GNETAGA sont essentiellement des  femmes mariées  ayant en moyenne 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant dans des familles monogames à MAMASSONI  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso). 
Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Tous les prêts précédents ont été bien soldés. Elles font  de la restauration et l’achat vente  des fruits et légumes tel AICHATA T.. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter, 5 paniers de fruits et légumes.  Elle s’approvisionne auprès des paysans producteurs et quelques fois au grand marché de  la ville de Sikasso auprès des grossistes.
Elle vend aux marchés, à domicile, au comptant souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle compte avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et  pouvoir aménager son coin de vente.
texts.en:
The members of the group GNETAGA are essentially married women averaging 36 years of age and three children living in monogamous families in MAMASSONI, a district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members are on their fifth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers.  The previous loans have all been settled.  

The group members are active in food service and in the buying and selling of fruit and vegetables, as in the case of Ms. AICHATA T..  With her new loan, she plans on buying 5 baskets of fruit and vegetables.  She gets her supplies from farmers and sometimes at the big market in Sikasso City from wholesale merchants.  Accepting cash and sometimes credit from her customer base composed of men and women, she sells at markets and out of her home.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 17,500 francs CFA.  Part of the profits will be put into savings.  The other part will be invested in her business.  She is counting on having more capital in order to satisfy her customers more and to fix up her sales location.

loans.use: Buying fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 40  ans et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passé ont été remboursés dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tel les pagnes wax avec la présidente du groupe, Sali B.. 
SALI B.  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 35 pagnes wax .
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de SIKASSO et à Bamako .
Les pagnes  wax sont revendus au  marché de MEDINE et à HAMDALLAYE à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.000 FCFA utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The five members of the SABOUGNOUMA group are married and, on average, are 40 years old and have 3 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in HAMDALLAYE, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso in the third administrative region of Mali. 

They are on their sixth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy the needs of their customers. The past loans have been repaid properly. 

This group of women sells various items such as "wax pagnes" (colorful traditional fabric) with the group’s president, Sali B.. 

Sali B. intends to buy 35 wax pagnes with her loan. She gets her supplies at the big market in SIKASSO and in Bamako. The wax pagnes are sold for cash at the market in MEDINE, at HAMDALLAYE in Sikasso and within the family to a customer base composed of men and women. 

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 75,000 CFA francs that will be used to cover the family’s daily expenses. She aspires to increase her revenue in order to satisfy her customer base.

loans.use: To buy wax pagnes

loans.name: Heremakono Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe HEREMAKONO sont essentiellement des  femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et en moyenne 4  enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à MAMASSONI  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso). 
Elles sont à leur huitième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.  Tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien soldés. Elles font la vente, de l’atiéké, du bois chauffe et  des  fruits et légumes   avec  ASSITAN D.. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 20 paniers de fruits et légumes. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso.
Elle vend en ambulant à Sikasso ville et à domicile, au comptant souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 49.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle compte avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et  pouvoir aménager son coin de vente.
texts.en: The members of the group HEREMAKONO are essentially married women averaging 38 years of age and four children.  They live for the most part in monogamous families in MAMASSONI, a district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members are on their eighth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers.  The previous loans have all been settled.   The group members sell atiéké (cassava couscous), firewood, and fruit and vegetables, as is the case for Ms. ASSITAN D.. With her new loan, ASSITAN plans on buying 20 baskets of fruit and vegetables.  She gets her supplies at the big market of Sikasso.  Accepting cash and often credit from a customer base composed of men and women, she makes her sales door-to-door in Sikasso City and also out of her home. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 49,500 francs CFA.  Part of the profits will be put into savings and used for family needs.  The other part will be invested in her business.  She is counting on having more capital to satisfy her customers better and to fix up her sales location.

loans.use: Buying various goods

loans.name: Agnes  Nyambura

texts.en:
Agnes Nyambura G. is 58 years old single mother of two daughters who are all grown up and independent. She has been selling clothes and bed sheets as a primary business and sells peanut butter as well. This business has lasted for six years with a maximum profit of Kshs.4,200 per month.  

Agnes has never borrowed from any MFI and this is her first loan from KADET LTD which she intends to buy more second hand clothes and bed sheets for sale and buy bigger containers for packing peanut butter.

The additional income she plans to plow back into the peanut butter business so that she can have enough to sell to her customers, since the demand is very high.  In future she plans to grow her business and build a house on a plot she had bought some time back.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes,bed sheets for sale and buy bigger containers for packing peanut butter

loans.name: Ladiri  (Loyalty) Group

texts.fr:
Ladiri est un regroupement de femmes  du quartier Hamdallaye de Koutiala qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et mères d’au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, le  bois de chauffe, les habillements et autres produits alimentaires etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. 
Saran  Touré qui est la présidente du groupe Ladiri  vend le bois de chauffe et divers autres articles tels les bonbons, biscuits, croquettes, arachide, chocolat, etc.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des chargements de charrettes en  bois de chauffe auprès des producteurs et divers autres produits alimentaires qui seront achetés au point final à Koutiala. Elle se procure en bois dans les villages tels Beleso, Sanga et Welengana. Son stock de bois est entreposé dans un endroit de la concession, est très important. Elle vend le bois en détail et au comptant  à  la maison à une clientèle composée exclusivement de femmes de ménages. Les produits alimentaires sont vendus aux abords de 
l’école privée Komi Diossé pendant la recréation. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe Ladiri comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Saran  Touré compte réaliser 70 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles comptent utiliser une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Ladiri is a group of women from the Hamdallaye district of Koutiala who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other parents.  The group members average 43 years of age and are mothers of at least five children.  They do commerce in a variety of goods, such as firewood, clothing, and food. To increase the size of their businesses, the group members decided to join the loan program at the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  

Saran Touré, who is the president of the group Kotognontala, sells firewood and various goods, such as candies, cookies, croquettes, peanuts, chocolate, etc.  She plans on using her loan to buy a few cart loads of firewood from producers and also some food items, which will be purchased at the end point in Koutiala.  She acquires firewood in the villages, such as Beleso, Sanga, and Welengana.  Her stock of firewood, which is very substantial, is warehoused in a place at the concession.  She sells the wood retail and for cash at the house to a customer base composed exclusively of housekeepers.  The food items are sold at a spot adjacent to the private school Komi Diossé during recess. 

While the group members each plan on making an average profit of 60,000 francs CFA over the course of the cycle, Saran Touré plans on making 70,000 francs.  In addition to repaying the loans, they plan on using a part of the revenues for coping with common family expenses.

loans.use: Buying a variety of items

loans.name: Jacob Ouko

texts.en:
Jacob Ouko O. is 58 years old and he is married to Claris Akinyi who is 50 years old. They are blessed with five children who ranges between 26 years and 13 years old. His wife supports him in producing additional income in the family.
