La Señora. Nancy tiene 44 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos de 23, 19 y 6 años de edad, su primera hija ayuda en la casa, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio y su ultima hija en la escuela, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Nancy se dedica a la venta de comida en un kiosco que es de su propiedad, actividad que la realiza hace 5 años, labora solo los fines de semana ya que los demás días de la semana se dedica al cuidado de su hogar.
 
Es socia fundadora del banco comunal y ahora  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de vajilla y víveres para su negocio. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Mrs. Nancy B. is a member of the Buscando el Exito ["Searching for Success"] community bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, known for its culture and traditions. The beauty of this city captivates natives and strangers; it has a large variety of gastronomy, its people are very kind and polite, and they maintain their culture and traditions. Nancy is 44 and in a common-law marriage. She has 3 children ages 23, 19 and 6. Her oldest daughter helps her in the house, her second son studies in university and her youngest daughter is in school. Nancy does not have her own home because she rents. She sells food in her own kiosk. She has been doing this for 5 years and only works on the weekends since on the other days of the week she cares for her home. She is a founding member of the community bank and she will invest her loan in the purchase of dishes and supplies for her business. Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase dishes and supplies.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina, de 46 años, convive con Juan, de 58 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Melina, de 24 y Enit, de 20 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de San Ramón (selva central peruana). Desde hace 20 años, Marina tiene una tienda de comestible, y una juguería (venta de bebidas a base de frutas) llamada “Talía”, según menciona en periodo de navidad implementó su tienda de comestibles con panteones, vinos, chocolates y bastante leche; con ello está adquiriendo buenas ganancias. También Marina se está preparando para dar pensión a los profesores de su zona en época escolar, cocinando ricos platos criollos para su alimentación diaria, es por está razón que ella desea más adelante ampliar su negocio, no solo con comestibles, o jugos, sino también con un restaurante y convertirlo en un lugar donde las personas puedan encontrar de todo para la hora de comida. Ahora ella se está preparando para el periodo de verano, donde comercializa  gran cantidad de bebidas. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, y se siente agradecida con el trabajo realizado por los integrantes de su banco comunal, que son personas responsables y muy honestas. De adquirir el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar frutas por cajones, que le servirán para preparar las ricas bebidas, entre jugos y chupetes que en época de verano tienen gran acogida.
texts.en:
Marina is 46 years old.  She lives with her partner, 58 year-old Juan.  They have 3 children but live with only 2 of them: 24 year-old Melina and 20 year-old Enit.  They live in their own home in the town of San Ramon (in the central Peruvian jungle).

Marina has owned a grocery store and a 'jugueria' (selling fruit-based drinks) called 'Talia' for 20 years.  She tells us that over the Christmas period she stocked her grocery store with panettones, wine, chocolates and quite a bit of milk.  She is making good profits from this.  Marina is also preparing to provide food to local teachers during the school year, cooking rich creole dishes for their daily meals.  In the future, she would like to expand her business,  not only with food or juices and smoothies but also with a restaurant.  She would like to convert her business into a place where people can find everything they need at meal times.  Marina is currently preparing for the summer season when she will sell a large quantity of drinks.

This is Marina's eighth loan with MFP and she feels grateful for the work done by the members of her community bank.  They are all responsible and very honest people.  Marina will use her loan money to buy fruit by the crate load which she will use to prepare her rich drinks, smoothies and lollipops which are very popular in the summer.

loans.use: To buy fruit to make juices, smoothies and iced treats

loans.name: Bertha Rufina

texts.es:
La Señora. Bertha A. es socia del banco comunal Buscando el Éxito, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su cultura y tradiciones, la belleza de esta ciudad cautiva a propios y extraños, cuenta con una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente es muy amable y cordial quienes mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Nuestra socia tiene 53 años, es soltera y tiene 5 hijos, todos son mayores de edad, casados y viven  independientes. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Bertha se dedica a la venta de comida en un mercado de la ciudad, esta actividad la realiza hace 24 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde, cuenta con un puesto propio.
 
Se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 5 años y le gusta ya que tiene muy buenas amigas. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su negocio y vajilla. Su meta crecer mucho más en su negocio.
texts.en: Mrs. Bertha A. is a member of the Buscando el Exito ["Searching for Success"] community bank. She lives in the city of Cusco, known for its culture and traditions. The beauty of this city captivates natives and strangers alike; it has a large variety of gastronomy, and its people are very friendly and polite and they maintain their culture and traditions. Bertha is 53, single and has 5 children who are all grown, married and live independently. She does not have her own home because she rents. Bertha sells food in a market in the city. She has been doing this for 24 years and works every day of the week from 10 am to 3 pm. She has her own stall. She has been a member of the community bank for 5 years and she likes it because she has very good friends there. She will invest her loan in the purchase of supplies for her business and dishes. Her goal is for her business to grow much more.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and dishes

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora María V. es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad, vive en la comunidad de San Capa que es perteneciente a la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia se caracteriza por sus campos llenos de cultivos ya que su gente se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, mucha de su gente encuentra en la ciudad un trabajo para ayudar a la economía de su hogar.

La Señora. María tiene 65 años, es madre soltera de 5 hijos, son todos mayores de edad,  casados y viven independientes. Vive en su casa propia acompañada de un nieto de 14 años que estudia en un colegio de la ciudad.

Doña María labora en la agricultura, siembra hortalizas y también se dedica a la cría de pollos, cuyes y ganado. Vende la leche a los carros lecheros que pasan por el sector y todos sus animales los vende en su comunidad.

Nuestra socia es fundadora del banco comunal y le gusta porque tiene muy buenas amigas, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de animales como son pollos, cerdos, etc. Su meta es tener más animales para la cría.
texts.en:
María V. is a member of the "Nueva Amistad" (New Friendship) community bank.  She lives in San Capa community which is in Cumbe parish.  This parish is noted for its fields full of crops since its residents work in agriculture and livestock farming.  Many of its people find work in the city to help their household incomes.

María is 65 years old.  She is a single mother and has 5 grown-up children.  All of her children are married and live independently.  Maria lives in her own home with her 14 year-old grandson who studies at a school in the city.

Maria works as a farmer, growing vegetables.  She also raises chickens, guinea pigs and cattle.  She sells her cows' milk to the milk trucks that pass through her area and she sells all of her animals in her community.

Maria is a founding member of her community bank and she likes it because she has some very good friends in the group.  She will invest her loan money in buying animals such as chickens, pigs, etc.  Her goal is to have more animals to raise.

loans.use: To buy chickens, pigs and guinea pigs

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La Señora Ana C. es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad, vive en la comunidad 24 de Mayo que es perteneciente a la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia se caracteriza por sus campos llenos de cultivos ya que su gente se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, mucha de su gente encuentra en la ciudad un trabajo para ayudar a la economía de su hogar.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 51 años, es viuda hace 8 años y tiene 3 hijos de 32, 29 y 28 años de edad que son casados y viven  independientes. Con el sacrificio de su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Ana se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, vende  leche a los carros lecheros que existen en el sector o en su comunidad, también se dedica a la cría de animales los que vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.
 
Se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 10 años. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca. Su meta es mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana C. is a member of the Nueva Amistad (New Friendship) communal bank.  She lives in the 24 de Mayo community which is in Cumbe parish.  This parish is notable due to its fields full of crops because its residents are farmers and cattlemen.  Many of its residents find jobs in the city to help household economy.

The member is 51 years old, has been a widow for the last 8 years, and has 3 children who are 32, 29, and 28 years of age, are married and live independently.  Through sacrificing in her work she has managed to build her own house.

She works in farming and cattle raising.  She sells milk to dairy trucks that exist in her community and she also raises small farm animals that she sells whenever she has financial need.

She has been in the communal bank for the last 10 years.  She will use the money from her loan to buy a cow.  Her goal is to improve her crops.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: María Silvia

texts.es:
La Señora. María P. es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad, vive en la comunidad Los Alamos que es perteneciente a la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia se caracteriza por sus campos llenos de cultivos ya que su gente se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, mucha de su gente encuentra en la ciudad un trabajo para ayudar a la economía de su hogar.

La Señora María se dedica a la venta de frutas, hortalizas, granos etc., en un mercado de la ciudad, esta actividad la realiza hace 12 años, cuenta con un puesto propio y labora de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.
 
Doña María tiene 34 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 15, 13, 11 y 6 años de edad, los dos primeros  estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer profesional, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su cuñada,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más hortalizas y frutas para su negocio. Su meta es crecer mucho más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. María P. is a member of the Nueva Amistad (New Friendship) communal bank.  She lives in the Los Alamos community which is part of Cumbe parish.  This parish is notable due to its fields full of crops because its residents are farmers and raise cattle.  Many of its residents look for work in the city to help our their household economy.

María sells fruit, vegetables, grains, etc. in one of the city’s markets.  She has been in this line of work for 12 years.  She has her own stand and works from Monday through Saturday from 8am until 5pm.

María is 34 years old, married with four children who are 15, 13, 11 and 6 years of age.  The two oldest are in high school and the two youngest go to a city elementary school. Her husband is a professional driver.  Their efforts as a couple have led to their building their own house.

This is her second loan in the communal bank.  She was invited to join by her sister-in-law.  She will use the money from her loan to buy more vegetables and fruit for her business.  Her goal is to grow much more in her business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products for resale

loans.name: Rosa Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa C. e es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia se caracteriza por sus campos llenos de cultivos ya que su gente se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, mucha de su gente encuentra en la ciudad un trabajo para ayudar a la economía de su hogar.

Nuestra socia tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 10, 9 y 7 años de edad, todos  estudian en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, con el sacrificio del trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora Rosa se dedica al arreglo de casas, actividad que la realiza hace 6 años, trabaja de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo ya que sale del trabajo en el momento que termine de realizar todos sus quehaceres. En su casa se dedica a la cría de gallinas y cuyes los que son mas para su consumo pero cuando tiene  alguna necesidad económica los vende en su comunidad.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal, el dinero de su crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de animales y  materiales para acabar su casa. Su sueño es seguir conservando su salud.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa C. is a member of the Nueva Amistad (New Friendship) communal bank.  She lives in the Los Alamos community which is part of Cumbe parish.  This parish is notable due to its fields full of crops because its residents are farmers and raise cattle.  Many of its residents look for work in the city to help our their household economy.

Rosa is 32 years old, married with three children who are 10, 9 and 7 years of age; they all go to a local school.  Her husband is a bricklayer.  Their work as a couple has resulted in their building their own house.

She works as a domestic employee in houses.   She’s been in this line of work for 6 years. She works from Monday through Friday without a fixed schedule since she gets off work when she finishes all her duties.  At home she raises chickens and guinea pigs which are for personal consumption mostly but which she does sometimes sell when she has financial need.

This is her second loan with the communal bank.  She will use the money to buy animals and building materials and supplies to finish her house.  Her dream is to stay healthy.

loans.use: To buy chickens, guinea pigs and building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Batmunh

texts.en: Batmunh G., 37 years old, lives with his wife and three children in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Batmunh and his family live in their own ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent. His wife is a homemaker and their three children attend high school. Since 2004, Batmunh has been operating a manufacturing business as well as selling meat. With his successful business, he bought a car, tools and already has his own workplace. Batmunh is a handy and talented man. He is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to purchase more tools and boards for his manufacturing business.

loans.use: to purchase more tools and boards

loans.name: Manarbek

texts.en: Manarbek K. is a 36-year-old single man who lives with his mother and two sisters, both of whom are university students in the Bayan-Ulgii province. He has been operating a raw material sales business since 2007. As a result of his successful business, he bought a car. Now, Manarbek is operating a taxi business so he can make a stable income, because his raw material sales business is a seasonal trade. In the future, he hopes to build a house. Manarbek is a simple and nice person. he is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy a new car to use for delivery of raw materials.

loans.use: To buy a new car

loans.name: Murat

texts.en: Murat B., 46 years old, is married and has three children. He and his family lives in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His two daughters attend a local high school. His wife and eldest son together help him with his work. Murat has been operating a meat trade business for about nine years. He started his business with a 300,000 MNT loan. During those years his business grew and now he owns a house with eight rooms. Murat said, "with my successful business, I made my own house and we living happily." He spent his own capital to buy about 60 livestock. He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to pay for more meat, and also to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To pay for more meat and increase his working capital

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn J. is from the town of Banga. She is 40 years old. Emelyn is married and has three children, aged 17, 13 and 12. To make a living, Emelyn raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Emelyn also grows pigs for fattening. She sells the pigs to the market.

Emelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Emelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and feeds.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and feeds

loans.name: Munhtsetseg

texts.en: Munhtsetseg T. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She and her family live together in their own house. Her two sons attend a local high school and her daughter, who is a one-year-old, attends a kindergarten. Her husband works in the government organization in their town. Munhtsetseg began her business in 2002 in the "Uguuj" shopping center. She has been operating a general products trade business. Within a short period, they have built a stable and successful operation and today their working capital has increased to a level of 4,000,000 MNT and they bought car. In the future, she wants to open her own magazine. She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase and import more general products from Erlian, a border city in China, to sell at two different places for the upcoming New Year holiday.

loans.use: To purchase and import more general products

loans.name: Purevdorj

texts.en:
Purevdorj G. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He and his family live together in their own house with a fence. His three children attend a local high school. 

Purevdorj operates a shoe-making business. He and his wife started their business in 1992 and have since gained much experience in shoe-making. Over the years, he has managed to establish his business into a stable operation with a customer base. 

Purevdorj wants to raise money and help his children go to university and be well-educated. Purevdorj is a modest and hardworking person and is requesting a 2,500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase materials and supplies at a wholesale price for making shoes.

loans.use: To purchase materials and supplies at a wholesale price

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A. is from the town of Banga. She is 42 years old. Evelyn is married and has six children. To make a living, Evelyn raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Evelyn has been engaged in farming for more than four years.

Evelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. This will be the first loan taken out by Evelyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Oyun D. is 43 years, married and lives with her six children in a house and fence in Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her husband attends university of Australia, her three sons attends a local primary school and two daughters both attend a kindergarten. She started sewing for a company. Since 2010, Oyun began her own sewing business at home. She bought woolen blankets of camel and used them to sew traditional Mongolian style boots worn by babies. For the future, she plans to expand her business by making her own garment industry. Oyun is a hardworking women who is a feeding her family. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more fabrics, tools, and a sewing machine for her business.

"

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics, tools, and a sewing machine

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina S. is from the town of Banga. She is 53 years old. Florentina is married. To make a living, Florentina raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Florentina earns 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month from farming. She wants to improve her income.

Florentina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florentina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Florentina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma L. is from the town of Banga. She is 46 years old. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a business planting & harvesting corn for sale. Gemma works hard to increase her harvest. She hopes to earn better.

Gemma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose, 63 years old, is from the town of Banga. He is engaged in farming. He plants and harvests rice and corn crops. He sells his harvest at the market and with what he earns, he provides for his family's needs. Jose hopes to improve his business and earn better. He wants to improve his family's living conditions.

Jose needs seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000, which he will use to buy what he needs for the farm. Jose is hopeful that this loan will help him improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith, 53 years old, is from the town of Banga. She is married and has three children, ages 21, 19 and 16. Her children go to school and she dreams for them to have bright futures. To make a living, Judith plants and harvests corn and rice for sale.

Judith joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Pol

texts.en: Mrs. Pol C. T., age 38, is a mother blessed with two children who are single and studying in public school. She currently generates an average income of $2 a day by selling Khmer cake in her village. Mrs. Pol C. T. has a life partner in her husband, who is a motor taxi driver at the Kompong Tmor Market, Kompong Tom province. Recently, Mrs. Pol C. T. says that the house which she and her family live in is too small and narrow. She wishes to buy a medium-size parcel of land for building a bigger house than present, but her money is not enough to do that. This is the reason she is asking for a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy land to build a bigger house

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora L. is from the town of Banga. She is 42 years old. Leonora is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Leonora owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Leonora wishes to be a successful businesswoman.

Leonora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other inputs

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes A. is from the town of Banga. She is 46 years old. Lourdes is married and has four children aged 21, 19, 17 and 15. All her children go to school. Lourdes works hard to provide for her family and sustain her children's education. She plants and harvests corn and then sells it at the market. She also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and then sells them at the market.

Lourdes joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to buy fertilizers, feed and piglets.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, feed and piglets

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn S. is from the town of Banga. She is 60 years old. To make a living, Merlyn raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. She also planted coconut trees on part of her land. Merlyn plans to raise pigs soon.

Merlyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase corn seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve it.

loans.use: To purchase corn seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred M. is from the town of Banga. She is 38 years old, married and has three children, ages 14, 12 and 11. Mildred's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale.

Mildred joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Mildred has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Tek

texts.en:
Tek R. is a married woman who earns a living by planting rice in the Kompong Tom Province.  Her husband assists with her farming business.  He also sells bran for an additional fee to the other farmers in and around his community, earning revenue of approximately $2 per day.  The couple has seven children, five of whom are single and two of whom are married.  Two of their children work and they always share their profits to help with daily expenses.

This rice harvesting season, Tek R. needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store.  She will sell the sacks when rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of rice to store and sell.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is from the town of Banga. She is 43 years old. Nilda is married and has four children, who are aged 21, 20, 19 and 13. She is engaged in farming. She plants and harvests rice and corn crops. Nilda sells her harvest to the market and sometimes to the next town's market also. Nilda wants to be a good mother and wife. She wants her family to be happy and healthy always.

Nilda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nilda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nilda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to buy rice and corn seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy rice and corn seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ramonito

texts.en:
Ramonito L. is from the town of Banga. He is 61 years old. Ramonito is married and has one child. He grows rice and corn on his land. He spends most of the day tilling the farm and keeping it free of weeds and pests. He also grows pigs for fattening. He sells the pigs to the market.

Ramonito joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Ramonito is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and feed. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and feed

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose L. is from the town of Banga. She is 48 years old and married. To make a living, she plants and harvests corn for sale. She has been engaged in farming for over 28 years.

Rose joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, 46 years old, is a married woman from the town of Banga. She has five children who go to school. She grows rice and corn crops. Her husband is also a farmer and they both do their best to keep the farm productive. Ruth sells their harvest to the market. Ruth wants to be able to sustain her children's education until college. She wants them to have bright futures.

Ruth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a  loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers. This will be her 1st loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sharon Rose

texts.en:
Sharon Rose, 34 years old, is from the town of Banga. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice and corn for sale and also grows pigs for fattening. She sells the pigs to the market.

Sharon Rose joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and feeds

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian N. is from the town of Banga. She is 39 years old. Vivian is married and has two children, age 11 and 9. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice and corn for sale. She also owns a small backyard piggery where she fattens pigs and then sells them.

Vivian joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and feed.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and feed

loans.name: Luciano

texts.en:
Luciano, 49 years old, is from the town of Talibon. He is married and has two children, age 17 and 16. To make a living, Luciano owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Luciano has a dream of becoming a politician. He says he wants to be of service to his townsfolk.

Luciano joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

He is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam A. is from the town of Talibon. She is 29 years old and is married with four children, ages 9, 7, 5 and 3. To make a living, she prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. Miriam started her business a year ago.

She joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miriam is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her 1st loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda M. is from the town of Talibon. She is 52 years old and married. She has children who go to school. To make a living, Imelda owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She also fattens pigs for selling and hopes to acquire more piglets to raise.

Imelda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a  loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to buy two piglets and feed for them, and also additional merchandise to sell in her store. This will be her first loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and feed for them, and also additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana G. is from the town of Talibon. She is 54 years old and married. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She opened her store four years ago.

Susana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her first loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria D. L. is from the town of Talibon. She is 46 years old. Victoria is married and has two children, age 14 and 11. To make a living, Victoria owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business.

Victoria joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie V. is from the town of Talibon. She is 25 years old. Vergie is married and has two children, age 5 and 3. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She started her store three years ago.

Vergie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a  loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Omurjan

texts.en:
Omurjan B. lives in Kozhomkul, a village in the northern part of Kyrgyzstan.  He is married and has two children.  Omurjan was born into a family of farmers and helped his parents with farming and cattle breeding, which helped him gain useful experience.  After serving in the army, Omurjan worked as a tractor driver at the state farm.   

In 1995, Omurjan decided to start his own cattle breeding business in order to earn a living to support his family.  Omurjan bought one bull-calf with the money that he had put aside for a rainy day.  Due to his persistent and hardworking personality, Omurjan managed to multiply his investments and bought a used car.  Today, his farm has two milk cows and he sells their milk at the local market.  He also has three horses and forty sheep. 

Omurjan is applying for a loan of 120,000 KGS to buy two milk cows and three bull-calves.  With the revenue, he plans to broaden his business by purchasing more cattle for fattening.  In the future, Omurjan plans to buy a house for his family in the town of Karabalta. 

The Kiva partner Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan.  As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena N. is from the town of Talibon. She is 43 years old and married. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice for sale. She started her business five years ago and earns approximately $75 per month.

Lucena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 1st loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Nov S., 53, makes a living selling Khmer noodles in the busy market. She has been operating this business since 2000. Her husband also helps her with the business. They have four children, two of whom are single and living under their care. The other two children work in different occupations, and they often contribute their salary with Nov S.. Nov S. always uses her motorbike as transportation to pick up her products to the market. Currently, her old motor bike was broken down while operating process. Because her saving account is no enough to buy other one in order to replace the broken one Nov S. would like to request a loan to buy a used motorbike for replacing the broken one, so she can go on her selling business.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike for replacing the broken one.

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
Vahe S. was born in 1983 in Ijevan city, Tavush region. He is married and has two children, a son and a daughter. His wife stays at home and takes care of their children and Vahe works as a crane operator. He takes orders for loading and unloading building materials and other goods, and thanks to this employment he is able to support his family. He takes orders not only from Ijevan city, but from other cities and villages in the Tavush region. He says his service is in popular demand, so he must always maintain his crane.

Vahe needs a 900.000 AMD loan to change his crane’s gearbox and to do some other repair work on it. This is Vahe’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To change his crane’s gearbox and do some other repair work on it

loans.name: Keth

texts.en: Keth R. is a 28-year-old married woman who lives in Kompong Thom Province. She sells soft drinks, fast food, sweets, shampoo, and plastic products in front of her house. She makes an income of approximately $2 per day for using in the family’s expenses. She has been married for many years to Ros Put, 30, a hairdresser in the local market.  They have two children, all of whom are studying in public school. Keth R. runs her business very well due to the good public relations skills she uses with her customers.  Keth R. wishes to increase her capital as a fund to buy more inventories, such as shampoo, plastic products, and other necessary items, which she will then sell. She hopes to use the rest of funding to decorate her old house and to pay construction fees. These are the reasons she has decided to apply for a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, plastic products, and other necessary for selling.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a forty-year-old married female with three children, and she owns a house in Kasese. She has been in the pharmacy business for twenty years. Her vision is to turn her business into a clinic and to educate her children. Rebecca needs the loan to buy drugs for her shop.

loans.use: To buy medicines for resale.

loans.name: Fideri

texts.en: Fideri is a thirty-year-old married man with three children, and he owns a house in Kasese. He has been in agriculture for the last ten years. He started with tomato farming on a small scale, but later diversified into many crops such as rice, maize, potatoes and beans. His hardships include climatic changes, pests, diseases and price fluctuations. His vision is to have a bigger and more stable commercial farm, plus a well educated and business oriented family. Federi intends to use the loan to buy seeds and pesticides.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Nyamgongor

texts.en:
Nyamgongor B. is 52 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Zavhan province, Mongolia. Her older son lives separately while her younger son attends a local school. Nyamgongor and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent and fence.
Nyamgongor began her meat-selling business in 1995 and since then has gained a lot of experience. She buys livestock and meat in bulk from the countryside and sells it in her town. Her husband helps in her meat business. Nyamgongor is a loyal and hardworking woman. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more meat for her meat-trading business.

loans.use: To purchase more meat for resale

loans.name: Hoeung

texts.en: Hoeung L. is a 38-year-old woman who lives with another family member in Kompong Tom Province. To earn for living, she sells some chickens in the Krolang market, and makes a profit about $3 per day. She and her husband usually go to buy chicken in bulk at the cheapest price possible from rural people whose houses are full of poultry that they raise for selling. In addition, her husband is also a local farmer, and now he grows a few watermelons in his farmland. When it is mature, he always picks the finished product to sell in the busy market for extra fee. The coming rainfall is good for his crop, but now her husband doesn’t have capital yet to use on his farm. So that, Hoeung L. is looking for a loan for her husband to buy a cultivating machine to plow on farmland and to purchase fertilizers, and watermelon seeds for planting.

loans.use: To buy cultivating machine to plow on farmland and to purchase fertilizers, and watermelon seeds for planting.

loans.name: Pol

texts.en: Pol R., 58, lives in the province of Kompong Tom, and he six children, one is married, and is employed in garment factory as a sewing worker. The remaining five are single, and one of them is working in restaurant next to the local market. Pol R. can live in simple life because of selling firewood which he buys fR. other villagers in the bulk with low price and then sells out to gain profit. Pol R. could get an income fR. this carrier averaging $2 per day to support in his family with daily expense. Pol R. has no a life partner because he was divorced fR. his wife for years. Nowadays, Pol R. is seeking for a loan to buy two cows which can be rented out to farmers for additional income. The cow can also be used for breeding purposes so he can also raise its offspring. That is the reason why Pol R. would like to borrow a loan fR. Kiva.

loans.use: To buy two cows which can be rented out to farmers for additional income. The cow can also be used for breeding purposes so he can also raise its offspring.

loans.name: Kuch

texts.en: The man in the picture is Kuch R., 32, a fisherman. He usually needs to take eight hours a day to fish, in and around river in his community. He catches around 10 kilos of fish per day and sells them in bulk to his regular customers who are retail sellers in the market. His wife’s name is Eang Hor; she is 30 and assists him in the same business. The couple is blessed with two young kids who are still enrolled in school. Kuch R. will use his loan to purchase nets, traps, and other fishing equipment so he can catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase nets, traps, and other fishing equipment so he can catch more fish.

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Erdenechimeg S. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Zavhan province, western Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest daughter attends the Mongolian State University of Education in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia, while her other two daughters attend a local secondary school.
Erdenechimeg operates a clothing sales business in her province. She started her business in 2003 selling a small number of products. After years of successful operation, her working capital has doubled in size. She hopes to continue her business success. Erdenechimeg is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more products in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more products

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a member of Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, with the Jasho Letu group. He runs the Master B. transport business. He has been engaged in this business for five years and has managed to employ eight people. In addition, he operates a retail shop to earn extra income.
Faulu Kenya has played a significant role in Wycliffe's business by funding him. This has helped him to improve his business. Wycliffe is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to repair his van. He dreams of purchasing two more vans for transport in the future.

loans.use: To repair his van

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 28 years old and a single mother of one. She runs a food stall to earn a living. In her business, she has employed one person. In addition to the food stall, she also runs a grocery store to supplement her income. Since Nancy joined Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, she has become more focused in her business and she now hopes to open a hotel in five years' time. With this loan of 30,000 KES, she will renovate her food stall.

loans.use: To renovate her food stall

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Yem S. is 27 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. Yem S. is a singer, and she always goes in and around her community to sing some songs with her orchestra for earning profit. She could get an income with this job at about $2 a day. She is married to Mr. Teng Sokhun, age 27, and he makes a living selling ice cream in his village. This couple has given birth to a kid who is studying in local school. Currently, her husband’s business is not running smoothly because his old barrel, which he used to put ice cream for selling, is broken down due to use and process. Yem S.’s husband wishes to change a new one but he lacks fund to make it possible. To encourage him, Yem S. will use her loan for her husband to purchase a new barrel in order to replace the broken one so he can go back to ice-cream selling business.

loans.use: To purchase a new barrel for replacing the broken one so he can go back to ice-cream selling business.

loans.name: York

texts.en: York S. sells a few wares in front of her home. She sells the items like soft drink, sweets for kids, and some cooking supplies. Besides this selling business, York S. is also a local farmer. York S. owns a big farm that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows various crops on it. She currently plants a peanut crop and she estimates that she will harvest it within the next two months when the plants mature. York S. will use the income from selling her mature produce to better meet her family’s needs. Her husband helps her to grow crops. York S. has another farm that she owns, but she is still not planting crops on it. She hopes to use his Kiva loan to hire a machine to plow farmland and to buy more peanut seeds for planting.

loans.use: To hire a machine to plow farmland and to buy more peanut seeds for planting.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a young man from Rafah city in Gaza strip, married and a father of Shahd, five years old, Hani, three years old and Tamner, one year old.

Muhammd took a loan from FATEN to purchase home appliances he needs for his family, such as a fridge and other necessary items.

Muhammad, who appears in the picture here, is a Palestinian National Authority employee.

loans.use: To purchase home appliances

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem Y., age 40, is married with three children, all of whom attend school.

Hem Y. is a domestic rice trader in her community. She always buys rice in bulk at a reasonable cost to mill. She then sells her finished rice to others so she can earn an income. Usually Hem Y. generates around $3 of profit a day to meet the needs of her family.

Her husband is a local farmer as well as a cow trader. He earns a profit on average of $2 per day. He shares responsibility with Hem Y. for meeting their family's needs.

This rice harvesting season Hem Y. needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store. She will sell them when rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of rice.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: Otgonbayar D. is 24 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Kharkhorin province, Mongolia. He  and his family live together in their own house. Otgonbayar operates a souvenir sales business in the Erdene Zuu monastery during the summer months when many tourists visit. In addition, he and his wife sell a variety of clothes at the local market. Otgonbayar started his clothing sales business in 2008 and has since built a stable operation. In the future, he hopes to establish his own souvenir store and is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to buy more souvenir goods and supplies for his souvenir sales business.

loans.use: To buy more souvenir goods and supplies

loans.name: Lucy Wanjiru

texts.en:
Lucy Wanjiru K. is 33 years old. She is married to Benson Mwangi, who is a salesman. Together they have two children.

Lucy owns a retail shop, which is her primary business. She also runs a kerosene pump and manages rental houses in the Baba Dogo Estate, which is just a few kilometers from the Nairobi town centre. She has run her business for the last 11 years, with a maximum profit of Kshs. 8,000 per month.

Lucy is applying for her first loan of Kshs. 30,000 from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a KADET client. With the loan, she plans to buy more stocks of food, more kerosene for sale, and complete some of the rental houses.

With the profit she anticipates to earn, she will complete construction of the rental houses and finish the houses with nice details. In the future, she hopes to build a home for her family and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of food, more kerosene for sale, and complete rental houses.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a single young man who is very industrious and hardworking. He is a dairy farmer, rearing dairy cattle for milk. He sells the milk to the residents of Kangemi. This is his primary business, in which he has been engaged for the last three years.

Aside from dairy farming, James is also an electrician by training and profession. He carries out repairs for the residents of the Kangemi trading center. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is already a member of KADET.

This is the first loan he is getting from KADET and he intends to use it to buy animal feed for his dairy cow. He will also invest in his electrical business by buying tools and other materials required for his job.

If the loan improves the business, he intends to open up an electrical shop to sell electrical gadgets and also to expand his farming.

loans.use: To buy animal feed to supply his dairy business and tools required for his job as an electrician.

loans.name: Hor

texts.en:
Hor Y. is a 43-year-old woman who currently lives in the province of Kompong Tom. She is a local chef. She is frequently hired by neighbors to cook meals for their wedding parties and other ceremonies.

Hor Y. lives with her parents and other relatives under one roof. Her parents could earn their own living by planting a rice crop.

On average, Hor Y. can make an income of approximately $4.80 per day. She shares her income with her parents and relatives so they can meet the family's expenses.

Presently, Hor Y. is not comfortable, because her kitchen often needs to be repaired. She would like a loan to buy wood to repair her broken kitchen.

loans.use: To buy wood to repair her broken kitchen.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita H. lives in Kapan city. One of her daughters is married and lives separately from her mother, and another daughter is a student in Yerevan. 

Five years ago Margarita organized her own business in a rented shop, and now she runs a gift shop and photographic studio at the same place. Her daughter's husband helps Margarita at her business, so part of the business income goes to her daughter's young family. 

She and her son-in-law take pictures and develop photographic films by themselves, and at the gift shop Margarita sells toys, pictures, clocks, statuettes, photo albums, frames and so on. With her son-in-law's help Margarita buys merchandise from Yerevan once a month. 

Margarita is asking for a 750,000 AMD loan to increase her gift shop assortment and to buy photographic paper, cartridges, etc. for her photographic studio. This is her 4th loan from Nor Horizon, and she has never delayed her repayments.

loans.use: To increase her gift shop assortment and to buy photographic paper, cartridges, etc. for her photographic studio

loans.name: Enhtur

texts.en:
Enhtur T. is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two children attend a local high school. 

Enhtur operates a car tire repair service and a tire sales business at his own workplace. He started this business in 2006 and has built a stable and successful operation within this short period. For the future, he plans to expand his tire repair service. Enhtur is a hardworking man and is requesting a 900,000 MNT loan to buy more parts and equipment for his tire repair business.

loans.use: To buy more parts and equipment

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is 45 years old, married, and the father of six.  He is a businessman who sells clothes.  He started the business ten years ago.  Previously, he was employed in a security firm.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money.  He plans to open a boutique in the future.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy blankets, bed sheets, mattresses, towels and socks.

loans.use: To buy blankets, bed sheets, mattresses, towels and socks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cartons of fish.

loans.name: Gemiima

texts.en: Gemiima is a forty-three-year-old married woman with seven children who lives in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She longs to build a permanent residential house. She is a teacher by profession and has worked for six years, which has enabled her to pay school fees for her children. Gemiima needs a loan to buy land.

loans.use: Purchasing a piece of land

loans.name: Bassam

texts.ar:
بسام متزوج وعمره 32 سنة له ولد يعمل في حدادة وبويا السيارات يحب عمله وله فيه 15 سنة
يعمل بجد ونشاط ويريد دائما التطور والمثابرة في العمل يريد لعائلته التطور والاستمرار في التقدم 
يسعى دائما الى تجديد مصلحته له تاريخ جيد جدا مع المجموعة كان يتلقى خلاله دعم كامل من العائلة
يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء معدات جديدة للمصلحة لزيادة الزبائن وتطوير العمل
texts.en: Bassam, 32, is married with a son. He has been working in the autobody repair and painting business for 15 years. Bassam is active, vigorous and persevering at work. He wishes to improve his family and work conditions. He likes his work and always gets his family's full support.  Bassam has a very good credit history with Al Majmoua. He seeks a loan to buy new equipment so that he can develop his business and increase his clients.

loans.use: To buy new equipment to develop his autobody repair and painting business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying sugar, soap and cassava flour for resale

loans.name: Quinto

texts.en: Quinto is 28 years old and married. He sells motor vehicle spare parts for a living.  He has been running the business for just one year.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been empowered economically and has learnt how to save his money.  He dreams of expanding his business into selling wholesale in the future.  He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy leaf springs, arms and bushes.

loans.use: To buy leaf springs, arms and bushes

loans.name: Hassan

texts.ar:
حسن في عمر 38 سنة يعمل في بيع الباطون ومواد البناء متزوج وله 2 ولدان يحب عمله ويسعى دائما الى تحسين الوضع المادي والعائلي والاجتماعي يريد تعليم اولاده خير تعليم له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة فهو تلقى دعم كامل من العائلة في دورته السابقة
له طموح كبير في تحسين وضع عمله وخاصة انه يلقى منافسة شديدة في محيطه العملي يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى
شراء مواد للبناء وزيادة تجارة الباطون بسبب اقتراب موسم تدشين المنازل في الشتاء حسن متطور مجتهد ونشيط له زبائن كثر من محيطه وجيرانه واقاربه
texts.en: Hassan, 32, is married with 2 sons. He works in selling concrete and other construction materials. Hassan likes his work and always seeks to improve his financial, social, and familial conditions. He wishes to provide his children with a quality education. Hassan has a good credit history with Al Majmoua.  He enjoyed his family's full support during his previous loan cycle. He is highly ambitious about boosting his business, especially amid the intense competition he faces. Hassan wants to get a loan from Al Majmoua to buy construction materials and expand his concrete business, especially because the high season for building houses is approaching. Hassan works hard and vigorously. He always likes to keep himself up-to-date.  He has many clients including his neighbors, relatives and other people who know him.

loans.use: To purchase concrete and other construction materials

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.ar:
عبد الله في عمر 29سنة متزوج وله ولد يعمل في محل لبيع القهوة و (المناقيش) والعصير له في عمله منذ 3 سنوات
يحب عمله ويسعى دائما الى تطويره ما يميز عمله انه يتقنه جيد ويريد تحسين بكل الوسائل لكن ما ينقص عبد الله المادة 
فقد فهو في طر التطور في عمله وهو يحب عائلته ويريد تأمين مستقبل جيد لهم تاريخه جيد مع المجموعة يريد من خلال طلب قرض
له من المجموعة الى شراء بضائع جديدة وتحسين المحل حتى يصبح قادر على استيعاب عدد اكبر من الزبائن
texts.en: Abdallah is a 29-year-old husband and father who loves his family very much and wants to secure their future. For the past three years, Abdallah has been working at a shop which specializes in coffee, juice, and fateera pies. He is very good at his work which he wants to improve by all means available. Accordingly, Abdallah is now seeking another loan from Al Majmoua (with which he has a good credit history) so that he may purchase more items for his shop and so that he can expand his shop to allow for more customers.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and expand shop

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en: Ambrose is a thirty-year-old man, married to a teacher, with one child, living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda with a family dream of educating his child and setting up a business. For a year he has been operating a restaurant and the business has tremendously grown although his dream is to own at least three restaurants. Ambrose intends to use the loan to buy food for sale.

loans.use: Buying food for sale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is twenty-seven years old, married with two children, living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda and her goal is building rentals for the family. She has been operating a salon for three years and this has generated minimal income to help her provide for the family amidst mishaps of bad debts. Beatrice needs the loan to buy synthetic hair and chemicals for the salon.

loans.use: Buying braids and cosmetics for her salon

loans.name: Kajugila Jane

texts.en:
Kajugila Jane M. has been selling clothes and detergent for the last five years in Hunters, Thika Road town. She gets a good income. She is 38 years-old and married with one child who is 13 years-old.

She was introduced to Kiva partner KADET LTD by a friend who is a client of KADET.  Jane is applying for her first loan of Kshs.10,000 in order to buy more stock of clothes to sell. She operates in an urban set–up where most of her customers are mainly low and middle income earners.

Jane hopes to grow her business and give her child a better education in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Faith Kanini

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a single lady of 36 years-old and the mother of one child. She lives in Ndundure in Emali town which is a rural town.  Most of the residents are small traders and low income earners.

She operates a general shop where she sells food items such as flour, cooking oil, tea leaves, sugar, etc. This is her primary business which she has been doing for the last two years. 

She got to know about Kiva partner KADET through a friend who was already a member.  She has never borrowed from other financial institutions.
With this loan advance, she plans to add more stock of tea leaves, salt, cooking oil and flour in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy tea leaves, salt, cooking oil and flour.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a thirty-two-year-old hard-working married man with five children, living in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda with a family goal of educating his children up to university. For five years he has been in farming and the retail trade which has facilitated him in providing the basics for the family. His mission is to become a wholesale trader although he still has challenges of insufficient capital to meet the demand of his customers.Haruna needs the loan to buy soft drinks, sugar and rice for sale.

loans.use: Buying soft drinks, sugar, and rice for sale

loans.name: Purity Wambui

texts.en:
Purity is a married woman of 20 years-old and the mother of one child. She stays at a place called Uthiru, Ndumbuini near the capital city. This is a middle class center and it has a high population.

She owns a butcher shop where she sells beef to the residents of Uthiru area. This is her primary business which she has been doing for the last two years.

She got to know about Kiva partner KADET through a friend who was already a member, and she has never borrowed from other financial institutions.

With this loan, she plans to buy Kshs 40,000 of additional  beef so that she can better meet her client needs.

loans.use: To buy more beef.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, oil, pepper, sardines, tomatoes, etc

loans.name: Taleb

texts.ar:
طالب في عمر 28 سنة متزوج يعمل في بيع الخبز والكعك متجول ليس لديه محل يحب عمله لكنه يسعى دائما
الى تطويره فهو طموح يحب ان يزيد من مدخوله وتحسين وضع عائلته يحلم بان يكون لديه محل خاص به لبيع الخبز والكعك
له في عمله 5 سنوات له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة يعاني صعوبة في التوزيع لعدم وجود السيارة يريد من خلال طلب قرض
من المجموعة الى شراء فان خاص به لتوزيع الكعك والخبز ما يميزه هي الارادة والمثابرة والطموح الدائم في تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي
texts.en: Taleb, a married 28-year-old, has been working for the past five years as an itinerant street vendor selling bread and pastries. He is distinguished by his determination, persistence, and drive to improve his lot. Given that he enjoys a decent credit history with Al Majmoua, Taleb would now like to ask for a loan to purchase a van to facilitate distribution.

loans.use: To purchase van for pastry vending business

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Mlle Adjowa   a 2 enfants   en charge et est âgée de 28 ans. Pour améliorer les conditions  de vie de ses enfants, elle fait le commerce de poissons fumés. Elle s’approvisionne  à Togo frigo. Après préparation, elle  revend ensuite les poissons fumés au marché Atikpodji. Elle a commencé cette activité en 1994 et  a déjà remboursé plusieurs crédits. Elle sollicite un prêt pour  acquérir 25 cartons de poissons frais.  La dame est habillé en bleu marine et est entrain de donner la monnaie
texts.en: Miss Adjowa is 28 years old and has two children in her care. In order to improve her children's living conditions, she sells smoked fish for a living. She sources the fish from Togo Frigo, then prepares them before selling the smoked fish at the Atikpodji market. She entered this trade in 1994 and has already repaid several microfinance loans. She is seeking a new one in order to purchase 25 boxes of fresh fish. In the picture above, Miss Adjowa is dressed in navy blue and is in the middle of giving a customer their change.

loans.use: purchasing fresh fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more underclothes and locks.

loans.name: Fahed

texts.ar:
فهد في عمر 31 سنة متزوج وله 2 ولدان يعمل في تعهدات المنازل بلاط ودهان وغيره له في عمله 11 سنة
يحب عمله وعائلته من اولى اهتماماته كان لقتراضه السابق مع المجموعة اثر ايجابي جدا على تحسين شكل العمل
لقد استطاع ان يتطور بشكل مميز وهو يلقى الدعم الكامل من عائلته ومحيطه هم زبائنه يتميز في سرعته بالابتكار 
ومجارته للتجدد لكنه يعاني صعوبة في المنافسة في محيطه العملي يريد خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء بيك اب خاص
له للعمل في نقل البضائع الخاصة بالتعهدات
texts.en: Fahed is a 31-year-old husband and father of two who for the past eleven years has been working in house contracting (tiles, paints, etc.), his customers coming from his surrounding community. Fahed is marked by his quick ability to innovate and his capacity for dynamism. The last loan had a very positive effect, enabling the applicant to further develop. Nevertheless, given the intense competition, Fahed would like to ask another loan from Al Majmoua to purchase a pickup truck to transport his merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase a pickup

loans.name: Bello

texts.fr: M. S. est né en 1952 et a 4 enfants  en charge.   Pour pouvoir   répondre aux besoins  de ses enfants, il  fait la couture. Mais il a associé la vente des  articles de mercerie. Il a débuté en 2001 cette activité et s’approvisionne dans un magasin  à Aguiarkomé.  Ensuite il revend dans un atelier à coté de l’ho tel Diamant. Il demande un crédit pour acheter un moteur à machine et 10 rouleaux de popelines.
texts.en: Mr S. was born in 1952 and has four children to support. To provide for their needs, he works as a tailor. In addition, he sells haberdashery articles. He began this activity in 2001. He gets his supplies in a store in Aguiarkomé. Then he resells the goods in his workshop located next to Hôtel Diamant. He applies for a loan to buy an engine for his sewing machine and 10 rolls of poplin.

loans.use: To buy an engine and poplin

loans.name: Palatina

texts.fr: Mlle Palatina est née en  1986 et  a un enfant en charge.  Elle est née  à Kouméa et habite quartier Gbinkomé. Elle fait le commerce de céréales et a débuté en 2005 cette activité.  Elle achète les céréales à kpalimé et revend a côté de la pharmacie satis à Gblinkomé.  Elle demande un crédit pour acheter  10 sacs de maïs, 2 sacs d’haricot et  8 sacs de mil.
texts.en: Miss Palatina was born in 1986 and has one child to support. She was born in Kouméa and lives now in the neighborhood of Gblinkomé. She has been trading with cereals since 2005. She buys the cereals in Kpalimé and resells them next to the pharmacy in Gblinkomé. She applies for a loan to buy 10 sacks of corn, 2 sacks of beans and 8 sacks of millet.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans and millet

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.ar:
محمد في عمر 27 سنة ليس متزوج يعمل في بيع السكاكر والمشروبات الغازية والقهوة له في العمل حوالي 3 سنوات
يحب عمله وعائلته يريد دائما التجدد في العمل يسعى الى امتالك عمل خاص به ويريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة 
الى توسيع المصلحة شراء بضائع جديدة له زبائن يقصدونه هم من جيرانه ومحيطه يتميز بالنظافة في العمل والدقة
وحسن المعاملة لكنه يعاني من صعوبة مادية ليزيد من مدخوله العملي
texts.en: Mohamed is 27 years old and single. He has been selling candy, sodas and coffee for the past three years. He loves his family and his job and is always seeking to enhance business. Mohamed would like to own a private business. Through a loan from Al Majmoua, he seeks to expand business and purchase new products. His clients are his neighbors and acquaintances. Mohamed maintains the shop well, and is accurate and courteous to his clients. He has financial difficulties and seeks to increase his income.

loans.use: Purchase new products for his shop

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Elle a 57 ans avec 6 enfants en charge et est mariée.  Elle est née à Aného et habite Ablogamé. Elle fait le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale et a commencé en 1992 cette activité. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend à côté d’Ecobank siège. Elle sollicite un prêt pour acheter 2 cartons de tomates, 2 bidons d’huile,  1 sac de sucre, 2 sacs de riz et 1 cartons de boites de sardines.
texts.en: Kayi H., aged 57, has six children to support and is married. She was born in Aného and lives now in Ablogamé. She has had a grocery store since 1992. She gets her supplies at the great market in Lomé et resells next to the head office of Ecobank. She applies for a loan to buy 2 boxes of tomatoes, 2 cans of oil, 1 sack of sugar, 2 sacks of rice and 1 box of cans of sardines.

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Messan

texts.fr: M. Messan a  44 ans et  est marié à une revendeuse. Il a 2 enfants. IL fait le commerce de matériel  Electrique  pour arriver à s’occuper de sa famille. IL compte dans  cette activité 5 déjà et s’approvisionne au marché local d’adawlato. IL sollicite un prêt pour acheter de nouveaux lots de matériaux électrique.
texts.en: Mr Messan, aged 44, is married to a reseller. He has two children. He sells electronics to provide for his family. He has been in this activity for 5 years already and gets his supplies at the local market in Adawlato. He applies for a loan to buy new lots of electronic goods.

loans.use: To buy electronic goods

loans.name: Wasim

texts.ar:
وسيم يعمل في تعهدات البلاط عمره 21 سنة يعمل في مصلحته من 5 سنوات يحب عمله ودائما التجدد به
طموح لكن ما ينقصه هو المادة لي يزيد من مدخوله في العمل يتميز في الجودة بالعمل والدقة والاتقان يعاني
من صعوبة في محيطه العملي يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء عدة جديدة للمصلحة + مواد اولية
وسيم شاب طموح متجدد
texts.en: Wasim works in floorings. He is 21 years old, and has been working in the field for five years. Wasim loves his job and is always seeking to develop. He is ambitious, but has financial difficulties. He hopes to be able to increase his income. He is diligent and accurate. Through a loan from Al Majmoua, Wasim wants to purchase a new tool set and raw materials. He is ambitious and constantly seeks improvement.

loans.use: To purchase new materials and raw materials

loans.name: Lami

texts.fr: Mme Lami a 5 enfants  et est mariée à un commerçant. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Née à Sotouboua mais habite quartier Agoè. Elle fait le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend les produits dans une boutique à son domicile. Elle cumule 10 ans dans cette activité. L’objet du crédit permettra d’acheter 20 sacs de riz, 15 cartons de tomate, 50 paquets de couche pour enfant et 5 cartons de sardine.
texts.en: Mrs Lami has five children and is married to a retailer. She is 40 years old. She was born in Sotouboua, but lives now in the neighborhood of Agoè. She sells grocery goods. She gets her supplies at the great market in Lomé and resells her goods at home in her store. She has been for 10 years in this activity. The purpose of this loan is to enable her to buy 20 sacks of rice, 15 boxes of tomatoes, 50 packs of diapers and 5 boxes of sardines.

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buying cartons of fish for resale

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew Okumu N. is 55 years old and married to Monicah Okumu, who is a farmer keeping poultry and dairy cattle. He runs a tailoring and dressmaking shop, and has been in this business for 20 years. Right now his monthly income from the business is 19,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

He is borrowing 30,000 KES and he plans to use it as follows: 20,000 KES to purchase men's and women's wear, and 10,000 KES to buy clothing materials to make more dresses. 

He will use the profit from the  business to invest in other businesses, i.e, buying shares in a company's premium bonds. This is his second loan after repaying his previous loan successfuly. His dreams and hopes are to own a company in the future.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for  men and women to sell ,and also buy clothe material for making dresses

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy crates of drinks and yards of carpet.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony K. is 32 years-old and married to Priscah Kiprop who produces an additional income of Kshs. 5,000.  They don't have children at the moment. He runs a retail shop and a posho (hammer) mill.

He has been in business for 11 years and right now his monthly income is Kshs 12,000.  He is borrowing a loan of Kshs 60,000 for a period of nine months.  With the loan, he plans to add stock to the retail shop and also to purchase maize for the posho mill.

Anthony plans to use the anticipated profit to purchase a matatu (share taxi).  This is his third loan and he paid his previous loans successfully. His hope and dream is have financial stability.

loans.use: To add stock to his retail shop and to buy maize for his mill.

loans.name: Shaaban

texts.ar:
شعبان متزوج وله ولدان يعمل في بيع واعادة تصنيع الخردة يحب عمله وله فيه حوالي 30 سنة يحب العمل الحر
الذي يعمل به لكنه يعاني صعوبة مادية كبيرة في تطوير عمله له تاريخ اقتراضي جيد مع المجموعة حيث كان يلقى
الدعم الكامل من العائلة ويريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء فان جديد لنقل الخردة حيث انه يجد
صعوبة كبيرة في نقلها على العربة يحب عائلته ويريد ان يتطور ويطور عائلته وان يكون يد فعالة في المجتمع
texts.en: Shaaban is married with two children. He sells and recycles scrap. Shaaban loves his job and has been in the field for thirty years. He enjoys the freedom of his work but suffers from great financial difficulties, which prevent him from enhancing his business. Shaaban has a good credit history with Al Majmoua. He has the full support of his family. Through his loan from Al Majmoua, Shaaban will purchase a new van to transport scrap. He loves his family and wants to secure a better future for them. He hopes to be a constructive member of society.

loans.use: To purchase a new van to transport scrap

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy bags of cement.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy hand bags and lappas

loans.name: Kitembe Tukwatanize Group

texts.en: Lawrence is a thirty-six-year-old widower with four children living in his own house in Fort Portal Uganda with an aspiration of educating his children up to higher levels of education. He trades in alcohol and has been in business for two years, still reaping tangible benefits amidst challenges of long distance and lack of transport facilities. Lawrence needs the loan to buy alcohol for sale.

loans.use: Buying alcohol for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy additional DVD and VCD dics to sell.

loans.name: Muvo Women's Group-Lugazi

texts.en:
50 year-old S. Alice has been affiliated with Muvo Women's group-Lugazi for the past 12 years. In the course of these years, she has been living from profits from a retailing business which is situated in Mabira-Lugazi. Alice, who previously farmed, says it was her husband's suggestion and support that that set her forth in this business.

Alice sells all types of retail general merchandise that is very popular with the majority of persons around her operating area.  Close friends say Alice is dedicated, hardworking and has always been unwavering in her determination to succeed. 

Alice's optimism about the future success of her business is sky high. She says that beginning to sell wholesale is a prospect she is highly taking into consideration. Weekly, this business generates 120,000 shillings of revenue.

With this loan, Alice, a happily married mother of two children, plans to buy more general merchandise retail stock to resell.

loans.use: To buy more stock.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
