Her story is generally representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti).

loans.use: To buy clothing, women's handbags and phone cards

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 28 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería,  ella tiene mucho tiempo de experiencia en su negocio, es una persona responsable que disfruta de su actividad. Disfruta de mantener a su familia para brindarles el pan de cada día, está ubicada en su vivienda en donde ofrece una gran variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, detergentes entre otro. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de mercadería y así mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Juana is 28 years old.  She owns a general store and her experience in this business spans a long period of time.  She is a responsible person who enjoys running her business.  She also enjoys providing the daily bread to support her family.  Her general store is located in her home where she offers a large variety of products such as candy, soft drinks, grains, and detergents, among other items.  She will use the loan for working capital to buy merchandise and, in this way, improve her profits.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Amparo Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Amparo de 36 años, habitante del Municipio del Coral Chontales, su familia esta conformada por su esposotrabaja en la Alcaldia Municipal el Coral obteniendo un salario mensual el cual le permite colaborar en los gastos del hogar  y 1 hija mayor de edad la cual colabora en los quehaceres de su pulperia, la Sra. Amparo desde hace 10 años tiene establecida su pequeña Pulperia la cual le genera ingresos diarios de donde abastece el sustento de la Familia. 

Necesita este financiamiento para ampliar la venta de productos y poder sastifacer la demanda de sus clientes permitiendole mejorar las fuentes de ingreso a nivel familiar; ella cuenta con exelentes recomendaciones por ser una persona responsable, amable y con muchos deseos de superacion.  

Su mayor sueño es que no les falte el pan de cada dia y ampliar su Negocio.
texts.en:
Amparo is 36 years old and lives in the municipality of Coral Chontales.  Her husband works in the Coral Chontales town hall. He contributes his monthly salary to the household expenses. She also has an adult daughter who contributes what she earns working in her general store.  Amparo’s small general store, which she established 10 years ago, generates a daily income that provides the family’s daily sustenance.

She needs this loan to increase the sale of products and be able to satisfy customer demand which will allow her to improve her household income. She has excellent recommendations for being a responsible, kind person who has a strong desire to succeed.  Her greatest dreams are to make sure that her family does lack daily bread and to expand her business.

loans.use: To supply her general store with products.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes has a long term partner, two children and lives in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

For around twenty years Mercedes has operated a colmado, a shop where you can find basic food staples. Colmados are within short walking distances from neighborhood homes. Mercedes started her business with her savings. She plans to use this loan, her seventh, to buy rice, flour and other foods. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business. She is one of our entrepreneurs who has had her business improved through an individual loan.

Mercedes says that her biggest challenge is to buy a vehicle. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying doing business and spending time with her family. Mercedes’ story is generally representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti.

loans.use: To buy rice, flour and other staples for her store

loans.name: Jairo Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Jairo Enrique J. S. sigue elaborando prendas de vestir en su taller de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Los meses de Diciembre y Enero son de temporada alta porque empieza a producir uniformes escolares a varios colegios de la ciudad que inician labores a principio de Febrero. Recientemente recibió la propuesta de elaborar los disfraces a dos comparsas que desfilarán en los próximos carnavales de Barranquilla, la fiesta folclórica más importante de Colombia y está estudiando la oferta. Este es el séptimo crédito que tramita en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la financiación de la matrícula del segundo semestre de su hijo en la universidad. Decidió hacer el préstamo para no descapitalizar el negocio. El crédito anterior, que también fue destinado a financiar los estudios superiores de su hijo, ha sido cancelado con una impecable puntualidad. El señor Jairo le manda un saludo muy especial a todos sus financiadores de Kiva, deseándoles mucha salud y prosperidad en compañía de sus familiares y agradeciéndoles la filantropía de ayudar a personas de escasos recursos. Para conocer la anterior presentación del microempresario, pueden acceder a través del siguiente link: 
http://www.kiva.org/lend/214472
texts.en:
Jairo Enrique J. S. continues making clothes in his shop in the city of Barranquilla.  December and January are the high season because he starts to make school uniforms.  He makes the uniforms for various schools in the city that start at the beginning of February.  He recently received a proposal to make the costumes for two groups who will parade in the next carnivals in Barranquilla.  The folkloric fiesta is the most important one in Colombia, and he is studying the offer.

This is his seventh loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He plans to use the loan for the entrance fees for his son’s second semester in the university.  He decided to ask for the loan so that he would not take money out of his business. His previous loan was also to pay for his son’s college education, and that payment was made very punctually.

Jairo sends very special greetings to all of the Kiva lenders.  He wishes them much health and prosperity as they are surrounded by their families.  He thanks them for the philanthropy of helping people who have scarce resources.

To learn about the previous loan given to this small businessman, click on the following link:  http://www.kiva.org/lend/214472

loans.use: To pay entrance fees for his son's second semester at the university

loans.name: Maria Eulalia

texts.es: Maria Eulalia tiene 35 años, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Ella vive en una zona que se encuentra algo alejada de la ciudad, por lo que ha sido muy difícil trasladar todos los productos que tiene que ofrecer en los diferentes lugares que recorre, pues va a los mercados, buses, entre otros. Por lo que desea adquirir una buena calidad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Para ello ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito para la compra de ropa interior, pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes para niños. Maria es una mujer bastante activa y que gusta mucho de trabajar para ayudar a su esposo a salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una mujer de confianza.
texts.en: Maria Eulalia is 35 years old.  She sells clothing for a living.  She lives in an area that is somewhat removed from the city.  Since she travels to the market by bus or other means of transportation, it has been very difficult to transport all of her products to the various locations where she sells them. So, she wants to buy good quality products to offer her customers.  For this reason, she believes it is appropriate to request a loan to buy undergarments, pants, shirts, skirts, and children’s suits.  Maria is an active woman who really enjoys working in order to help her husband get ahead in life. The people who know her hold her in high regard and consider her a confident woman.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Dieuf Dieul Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DIEUF DIEUL est créé depuis l'inauguration du Banc Villageois, il y a de cela environs 9 ans. Il est composé de 07 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village et se sont organisées par affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de NG.-NG..

Madame NOGOYE G. à l'extrême droite sur la photo levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. 

Elle fait une activité de petit commerce depuis plusieurs années. Elle vend des produits d'artisanat en paille tel que des vans, des corbeilles, et des paniers 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter des intrants pour la fabriques de ses produits. 

Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group DIEUF DIEUL was created since the inauguration of the Banc Villageois about nine years ago.  Organized by affinities, the group is composed of seven women who are all from the same village.  The group is part of the Banc Villageois of NG.-NG..

Ms. NOGOYE G. is the group’s leader (raising her hand at the far right in the photo).  She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of eight children.  For several years, she has had a small-scale business selling hand-crafted products made of straw, such as winnowing tools, trays, and baskets. Her new loan will enable her to buy the materials for making her products.  

She supports her husband in covering family expenses.

loans.use: Développer et faire la promotion de son activité de petit commerce

loans.name: Solidario Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
SOLIDARIO VIRGEN D. FATIMA

La señora Claudia Velásquez  necesita D. nuevo su crédito para la elaboración D. D. dulces típicos, que ahora entrega en diferentes  clientes,  sus ventas aumentan en  enero por la  feria patronal donD. tiene una gran cantidad D. visitas. La señora Ana Paulina  necesita su préstamo para la compra D. maíz Y productos comestibles para elavorar tamales ya que en este mes tiene más pedidos  por las fiestas D. fin D. año. La señora Berta Mariana C. necesita su crédito para  la venta D. productos plasticos,  y también la venta D.  comales  que tiene ubicada en el mercado Local D. otro municipio. Las tres miembros del grupo coinciden en que esta es una buena fecha para poder invertir y aprovechar antes D. que inicie el ciclo escolar en enero, ya que D. esta manera ellas se aseguran D. tener lo necesario para que los niños vayan a la escuela.
texts.en:
SOLIDARIO VIRGEN D. FATIMA

Claudia Velásquez needs credit again to prepare typical Guatemalan sweets that she delivers to various customers.  Her sales increase in January when there are many visitors to celebrate the feast day of the patron saint.  Ana Paulina needs her loan to buy corn and ingredients to make tamales since this month she has more orders for New Year’s Eve parties.  Berta Mariana C. needs her loan for plastic products and “comales” (flat earthenware pans for cooking corn cakes) that she sells in the local market of another town.  The three members of the group agree that since schools starts in January, this is a good time to take advantage of the opportunity to invest.  In this way, they will make sure that they have what they need for their children to go to school.

loans.use: Ingredients to make tamales and typical Guatemalan sweets and for the sale of plastic products.

loans.name: Gloria Luz

texts.es: Gloria Luz se dedica a la venta de mercadería general, ella disfruta de su actividad el relacionarse con sus clientes y saber lo que ellos le solicitan. Desde hace más de 11 años inicio ya que necesitaba algo que le ayudara a salir adelante y pagar los gastos de su familia, el objetivo que tiene es surtir su inventario ya que no tiene mucho en existencia. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de materia prima como calzado, perfumes, ropa en general y trajes ya que debido a la época navideña tiene varios encargos.
texts.en: Gloria Luz makes a living selling general supplies. She enjoys relating to her customers and knowing what they are looking for. She started her business more than 11 years ago because she needed something to help her make headway and pay for family expenses. Her objective is to stock her inventory because she doesn't have much at the moment. She plans to use the loan to purchase merchandise such as footwear, perfumes, general clothing and dresses since during Christmas time she has various orders.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es: Esperanza del Socorro se dedica a la venta de bolsas plásticas y tiste. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella es una persona con un gran carisma, ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos pues se siente muy feliz con este medio de vida. Ella se levanta muy temprano desde las 5 de la mañana para realizar la elaboración de su tiste que sus clientes buscan desde muy temprano. El crédito es para la compra de materia prima y satisfacer la demanda.
texts.en: Esperanza makes a living selling plastic bags and tiste, a popular regional drink. She has dedicated herself to this business for more than five years. She is a person with a lot of charisma who has shown herself to be very responsible. This is not her first loan request, and she feels very happy with this way of life. She gets up at 5 in the morning to make the tiste, which customers look for very early in the morning. She plans to use the loan to purchase supplies so she can satisfy demand.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Javier Fernando

texts.es:
Javier de 22 años, es un joven emprendedor que para continuar con la actividad económica de su papa comenzó a comprar víveres para ubicar una pequeña tienda. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral trabaja en su pequeña tienda vendiendo arroz, enlatados, bebidas etc. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta que anochece. Aun no tiene hijos ni está casado pero sus proyecciones es verse con su pareja e hijos por eso quiere comenzar a surtir su tienda para darles una buena vida en un futuro. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, arroz, azúcar, enlatados etc. En el futuro tiene planificado tener una papelería para asegurar su futuro económico.
texts.en:
Javier is 22 years old and is an enterprising young man who began to purchase groceries to add to a small store in order to continue his father’s business.

Living in a periurban zone called Perimetral, he works at his small store selling rice, canned goods, drinks, etc. from 7am until nightfall. He still does not have children and he isn’t married, but he sees himself with a partner and children in the future. This is why he wants to begin to stock his store in order to provide them with a good life.

With the loan, he wants to purchase drinks, rice, sugar, canned goods, etc. In the future, he plans to have a stationery store to ensure his future finances.

loans.use: Rice, sugar, drinks

loans.name: And Dieuf Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est depuis environs 9 ans, lors de l'ouverture du Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 08 membres toutes issues du même village et tissent de bonnes relations amicales. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de NG.-NG..

Madame RAMA L. à droite de la photo levant la main main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. 

Elle fait depuis longtemps un petit commerce de céréales et d'arachide

Avec son crédit de 100.000 francs CFA elle va augmenter son niveau production d'huile d'arachide et acheter plus de céréales pour revendre.

Son objectif est de participer au différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
This solidarity group has existed for about 9 years, starting at the time that the Banc Villageois opened.  The group is composed of 8 members, all from the same village, who are building good friendships.  The group is part of the Banc Villageois of NG.-NG..  

Mrs. Rama L., with her hand raised on the right hand side of the photo, is the president of the group.  She is 36 years old.  She is married and is the mother of 6 children.  She has long had a small groundnut and cereal business, and with her loan of 100,000 francs she will increase her production of oil and buy more cereals for resale.  Her objective is to contribute to various family expenses.

loans.use: To develop and promote their small business activity

loans.name: Ayudanos Senor 2, 3 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group, Ayudanos Senor (Help Us, Lord) 2, 3 & 7, a group made up of mostly Haitian citizens. Her story is representative of those in her group, and generally of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti.

Maria’s group is drawn from rural villages outside La Romana, an area of the country where sugar cane is grown and harvested. Running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She and her husband make their home here in a simple structure with their two children.

Maria's excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. Maria has a good stall and plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling fruit, vegetables, meat and other goods. She will use her profits to make improvements to her house and invest in the well-being of her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy fruit, vegetables and meats for her stall

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 30 años, está casada con Héctor, de 34 años de edad. Ambos tiene 3 hijos: Jessica, de 13, Piero de 6 y Sandra de 4 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. El trabajo al que se dedica está talentosa mujer es la agricultura, sus principales sembríos constan de papa, arveja, flor de gladiolo, siendo este último producto que más ingresos le genera, ya que cosecha semanalmente. Ya tiene 13 años dedicándose a ello y es conocida entre los vendedores del mercado mayorista de Tarma. Lo que le molesta de su trabajo, son las temporadas donde bajan los precios de sus cosechas, pero a pesar de las inconveniencias, está segura que podrá salir adelante, por ello está planeando tener ingresos extra. Ante esto planea ampliar su tienda de comestibles que tiene en la ciudad de Tarma, para ella es una buena inversión ya que se encuentra dentro de un ciudad de mayor movimiento comercial. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, y asegura que obtendrá buenos resultados en sus proyectos con el apoyo de su banco comunal, que son personas responsables y trabajadoras. De obtener el crédito que solicita, está pensando invertir en la compra de 20 sacos de abono orgánico los cuales oscilan entre 100 nuevos soles cada uno.
texts.en:
Nancy, aged 30, is married to Héctor. They have three children: Jessica is 13, Piero 6 and Sandra 4 years old. The family lives in its own house in the hamlet of Cumutay. This talented lady works in agriculture. Her main crops consist of potatoes, peas and gladioli. The latter is the most profitable product, because she can harvest it every week. Nancy has a 13-year experience in this activity and is well known among the merchants at the main market in Tarma. What bothers her in her work, are the seasons with low crop prices. However, in spite of the inconveniences, she is sure that she can progress.

Nancy plans to earn additional income. Given this, she plans to expand the grocery store that she owns in the city of Tarma. For her it is a good investment, because it is within a city of major commercial activity.

This is her eighth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she says that she will get good results with her projects thanks to the support of her communal bank, which consists of responsible and hard-working people. She intends to use her loan to buy 20 sacks of organic fertilizer at a price averaging 100 nuevos soles each.

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: El señor Nelson S. M. tiene 53 años y vive con su esposa y una nieta en la urbanización Villas De San Pablo de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Logró adquirir su casa a través de un subsidio que recibió del estado. Esta urbanización es  el primer macroproyecto de vivienda  en Colombia liderado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en asocio con el gobierno local y nacional. El microempresario es albañil de profesión y desde hace 18 meses tiene una pequeña ferretería que funciona en su residencia y en la cual vende materiales de construcción, artículos eléctricos y herramientas. En un principio el inventario y las ventas eran bajos, pero han crecido mes a mes porque cada vez hay más familias viviendo en el barrio y casi todas remodelan sus casas. En la atención del negocio, se turna con su esposa quien también presta el servicio de llamadas a teléfonos fijos y celular. Este es el primer crédito que tramita en la Fundación y planea invertirlo en comprar cemento,  ladrillos, láminas para techos y accesorios para tuberías en P.V.C. Esos son los artículos que más vende. El promedio de ventas diarias es de $ 120.000 COP y el margen de utilidad es del 35%.  El señor Nelson se declara un hombre afortunado porque ha sobrevivido a dos graves accidentes en motocicletas que le produjeron varias fracturas. Hoy está plenamente recuperado y no le quedaron secuelas. A principio del próximo año visitará un hijo que vive en la ciudad de Cali y su compañera quedará al frente del negocio por una semana.  En un futuro no muy lejano piensa construir un segundo piso en su residencia para separar su vivienda del negocio y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mr Nelson S. M. is 53 and lives with his wife and a granddaughter in the Villas de San Pablo development of the city of Barranquilla. He was able to acquire his house through a subsidy that he received from the state. This development is the first housing macroproject in Colombia lead by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in association with the local and national governments. Nelson is a bricklayer and has had a small hardware store in his home for 18 months, where he sells construction materials, electronic items and tools. In the beginning the inventory and sales were low, but they have grown month by month because each time there are more families living in the neighbourhood and almost all of them are remodeling their homes. He and his wife take turns working in the store. His wife also provides a landline and cell phone service. This is Nelson's first loan with the Fundacion, and he plans to invest it buying cement, bricks and laminates for roofs, and accessories for PVC tubes. These are the items that he sells the most. His daily sales average $120,000 COP and the margin of utility is 35%. Nelson says he is a lucky man because he has survived two serious motorcycle accidents that left him with various fractures. Today he is fully recovered and he has no lasting consequences. In the beginning of next year he will visit a son who lives in the city of Cali, and his wife will stay and look after the business for one week. In the near future he plans to build a second floor in his home to separate the living area from the business, thus improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks and laminates for roofs and accessories for PVC pipe

loans.name: Leonarda Yamilet

texts.es: Leonarda se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos, ya que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000.  Inicio ofreciendo pocos productos pero fueron los necesarios que sus clientes le solicitaban. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de calzado, perfumes, toallas y sabanas pues tiene ciertos pedidos debido a la temporada festiva.
texts.en: Leonarda sells general merchandise.  She is a very hard-working person.  This is not the first time she has asked for a loan, as she has spent a lot of time working with the León 2000 Foundation.  When she began her business, she offered only a few products, but they were the ones her customers needed.  Leonarda is asking for this loan to buy footwear, perfume, towels, and sheets because she has special orders due to the holiday season.

loans.use: Purchase of footwear, perfume, towels, and sheets

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna es una mujer de pocos recursos económicos, madre soltera  de dos hermosos hijos, ha tenido que trabajar mucho, para lograr sobre salir a delante.
Tiene su propio negocio, la venta de tortillas, cuajadas y los fines de semana hace sopa. 
Reyna ha venido haciendo su casa con los financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado, siendo el decimo crédito que será para embaldosar la casa ya que aun es de tierra y desea la mejora para una mejor higiene. 
Siendo una cliente que ha demostrado un buen comportamiento de pago en sus crédito, el cual está contenta por lograr una mejor vivienda para su familia.
texts.en: Reyna is a woman with few economic resources. She is a single mother of two handsome children. She has had to work a lot in order to get ahead. She has her own business selling tortillas and curds, and on the weekends she makes soup. Reyna has been working on her house with loans from Afodenic. This is her tenth loan and it will be used to tile her house, as it is still earthen--she wants to make this improvement in order to have better hygiene. She is a client who has demonstrated a good payment history, and she is happy to have achieved a better home for her family.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to tile  the room which is still earth, to obtain better hygiene

loans.name: Isura Maria

texts.es: La señora Isaura Maria tiene su negocio que es venta de artículos en general. Un obstáculo que ha tenido últimamente es la falta de movimiento de parte de los clientes. Ella desea continuar invirtiendo en mercadería en general, por lo que las artesanias es son los productos que sus clientes mas solicitan debido a esta temporada quiere aprovechar la demanda que sus clientes le estan solicitando, todos los dias tiene que levantarse temprano para preparar lo que tiene que mostrar. Su sueño, es establecer una tienda en el mercado. Ella tiene un hijo, que vive de manera independiente, pero le ayuda a ofrecer los diferentes productos que su Mama ofrece.
texts.en: Mrs Isaura Maria has a business where she sells general items. The most recent obstacle that she has encountered has been the lack of movement on the part of her customers. She wants to continue investing in general merchandise, in particular artesanal crafts which are most sough after by her clients. Demand for her products are very high during this time of year and she wants to capitalize on this market opportunity. Her dream is to open a merchandise store. She has one child who lives independently, but helps her sell the various products that she offers.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Edelmira De Los Angeles

texts.es: Edelmira De Los Ángeles tiene 39 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este medio de vida que con mucho entusiasmo ha logrado obtener, ella es una persona muy luchadora  inicio este medio de vida porque algunos familiares le proporcionaban ciertos productos para que Edelmira los ofreciera fue así con el paso del tiempo que logro obtener su propio negocio. El crédito está destinado para la compra de calzado, perfumes, ropa en general, toallas entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Edelmira De Los Ángeles is 39. She sells general merchandise. She has had this way of life for over 7 years and achieved it with great enthusiasm. She is a very hard-working person. She started this business because some family members gave her some products to sell. With the passing of time she was able to have her own store. The loan will be used to purchase shoes, perfumes, general clothing and towels, among other items.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Gabi

texts.es: Gabi, de 35 años, convive con Andrés, de 34 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Julisa, de 13 y Anderson, de 10 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. Desde las primeras horas de la mañana Gaby, comienza la venta de productos de primera necesidad en un pequeño espacio que acondicionó en su casa. Cuando termina su venta, ella, se dirige a sus sembríos de arveja, papa y maíz, donde hace 15 años comenzó a dedicarse a la agricultura, y según menciona la va muy bien; pues ahora la calidad de sus productos son muy cotizados en el mercado central de Tarma. Según afirma el movimiento económico del mercado es muy bueno, por ello está planeando invertir en la venta de verduras al por mayor. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, y como presidenta de su banco comunal, se siente dichosa de ayudar a las personas a salir adelante. De obtener el crédito está pensando completar la compra de 5 sacos de semilla de arveja, que oscila entre 600 soles cada uno.
texts.en: Gabi, age 25, lives with Andres, age 34. They have 2 children together: Julisa, age 13, and Anderson, age 10. They live in their own home in the Cumutay hamlet. In the first hours of the morning Gaby starts to sell basic needs products in a small area she set up in her home. When she finishes her sales, she sows peas, potatoes and corn. She started working in agriculture 15 years ago, and she says that it is going very well. Her quality products are very sought-after in the central market of Tarma. She says that the economic market movement is very good, and so she plans to invest in the wholesale sale of vegetables. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and as the  president of her community bank she is happy to help people get ahead. When she obtains this loan she plans to purchase five bags of pea seeds, which are approximately 600 soles each.

loans.use: to purchase 5 bags of pea seeds.

loans.name: Elsa Mariana

texts.es: Elsa Mariana Ordoñez R. o Ordoñez M. tiene 44 años es casada y tiene 6 hijos cuatro de ellos ya  estan casados y dos todavía van a la escuela su negocio es de venta de refacciones frutas y granizadas doña elsa a tenido mucha demanda en su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo han podido sacar adelante a su familia y necesitan la  ayuda de Fape  para que puedan otorgarle un crédito y que puedan invertir en su negocio y asi puedan generar mas ganancias y brindarle una mejor vida a su familia, Ella solicita el crédito para la  compra de productos comestibles para elavorar comida
texts.en: Elsa Mariana Ordoñez R. o Ordoñez M. is 44 years old, married and has 6 kids, four of whom are already married and two whom are already in school. Her business is the sales of fruit drinks. Doña Elsa has had good demand for her business. With the help of her husband, she has been able to move forward with her family. They need the support of Fape so they can receive a loan and can invest in her business and be able to take in more profits to bring a better life to her family. She asks for this loan to buy consumable products to make her foods.

loans.use: To purchase products to make food

loans.name: Juana Rafaela

texts.es: Juana Rafaela tiene 52 años, ella se dedica a una pulpería. Desde hace más de 9 años, pues tenía unos ahorros así fue que empezó con muy pocos productos sus vecinos, amigos y familiares siempre llegaban a buscar lo que ella ofrecía. Juana es una mujer responsable y disfruta de realizar este tipo de trabajo. Ella tiene pensando ampliar su negocio cada día más para que sus clientes puedan apreciar su muy bien sus productos. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, granos básicos entre otros.
texts.en: Juana Rafaela is 52 years old. She runs a general store. More than 9 years ago, she had some savings to start with a few products. Her neighbors, friends and family always came to look for the products that she was offering. Juana is a responsible woman and enjoys the work that she does. She has been thinking of expanding her business more every day so that her customers can enjoy her products. The loan that she requests is for the purchase of candies, sodas, bread, basic grains and others.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Norma Patricia

texts.es:
Norma de 29 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un negocio de cabinas telefónicas y a la misma vez hace confecciones y cose ropa. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso ha trabajado durante años con las enseñanzas que sus padres le dejaron. Comenzó con el taller de costura y confección después de una buena administración pudo ubicar  un negocio de cabinas telefónicas con ayuda de su esposo. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h00pm con ayuda de su esposo atendiendo el negocio de las cabinas y ella en el taller de costura y confección. 

Para seguir con sus pequeños negocio y surtir su negocio taller de confección ella quiere comprar con el préstamo telas, maquinas de coser. En el futuro quiere incrementar el taller de costura.
texts.en:
Norma is 29 years old. She is a working woman with a business in telephone booths and also sews and make clothes.

Living in a semi-urban area called Paraíso, she has worked for years with the teachings that her parents left her. She began with a business in sewing and after good management was able to open a business in telephone booths with the support of her husband. Now she works from 7:00pm with the help of her husband attending the phone business as she works in the sewing workshop.

To continue with her small businesses and supply her business in the sewing workshop, she wants to buy fabrics and sewing machines with this loan. In the future. She wants to expand her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and sewing machines

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda, de 43 años, está casada con Samuel, de 47 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 4 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. Está luchadora mujer se dedica a la agricultura, que junto a su hijo Wilder, se dirigen todas las mañanas a sus cultivos de arveja, papa y maíz; donde trabajan arduamente desde al amanecer hasta el anochecer.  Lo que más le gusta a Nilda, es cuidar de sus animales como vacas, toros, cerdos y corderos. Ya tiene 20 años dedicándose a ello, y afirma que a pesar de los inconvenientes que se suscitan constantemente, como en temporadas de lluvia, cuando aparece la enfermedad de “la rancha”, malogrando los sembríos. Ella tiene mucha fe y ganas de trabajar, ya que el campo “es su vida”, ahí nació y creció. Por ello más adelante desea construir una casa más segura donde pueda vivir y poner un negocio propio.  Es el octavo crédito con MFP, y como socia antigua de su banco comunal, se siente agradecida por todo el apoyo que recibe de parte de ellos. 
De obtener el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de varios sacos de abono, los cuales esparcirá en sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Nida is 43 years old. She is married to Samuel, 47 years old. Together they have 5 children, but they only live with 4 of them in their own home located in the rural town of Cumutay. This hard-working woman works in agriculture. Together with her son, Wilder, she heads to work every morning to her fields of beans, potatoes and rice where they work hard from dawn until dusk. What Nilda enjoys most is the care of her animals such as cows, bulls, pigs and sheep. She has already worked 20 years in this and upholds it despite the inconveniences that they are constantly experiencing such as rainy seasons, outbreaks of the “la rancha” sickness, and spoiling the seeds. She has a lot of faith and desire to work, since the country “is her life,” where she was born and grew up. In the future, she wants to build a more secure house where she can live and have her own business. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and as a longtime member of her communal bank, she is thankful for all the support that she receives from then.

Once she obtains the loan that she requested, she will invest it in the purchase of various bags of fertilizer, which she will use on her potato crops.

loans.use: To purchase several bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Flor De Maria tiene 33años, su actividad es la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que tiene  este negocio. Inicio por cuenta propia  tenía que mantener a dos de sus hijos que tenia a cargo y proporcionarle lo necesario. Ella es una persona muy responsable y disfruta de tener este medio de vida. El crédito que solicita  es para la compra de materia prima ya que actualmente tiene ciertos encargos como pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes debido a las festividades que nos encontramos.
texts.en: Flor De Maria is 33 years old. Her work is the purchase and sale of clothing. She has had this business for more than 5 years. She began on her own. She has to take care of her two children and supply the necessities. She is a very responsible person, and she enjoys having this life. The loan that she requests is for the purchase of primary materials since she currently has certain orders such as pants, shirts, skirts, and suits due to the holidays that we find ourselves in.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Paula Petrona

texts.es: Petrona Paula es una mujer muy luchadora se dedica a la elaboración de nacatamales y tortillas. Desde hace mas de 21 años que tiene este negocio y es muy bien conocida por sus clientes, pues la elaboración de sus riquísimos  productos es lo que los atrae. Ella inicio por su Mama quien se encargo de enseñarle este medio de vida que actualmente es su única fuente de ingreso. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de materia prima. Desea poder realizar mejoras a su hogar que para ella son necesarias.
texts.en: Petrona Paula is a hard-working woman who dedicates herself to making nacatamales and tortillas.  She’s had her business for over 21 years and is well like by her customers, who are attracted to her delicious goods. Her mother taught her this livelihood, which is currently her only source of income.   The loan she is requesting is for the purchase of raw materials.  She wishes to make some necessary improvements to her home.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Tamara Liseth

texts.es:
Tamara es una pequeña comerciante de venta de comida y venta de ropa pues en ambos negocio ha captado clientela, es madre de dos hijos, en donde trabaja mucho para lograr dar a sus hijos lo necesarios ya que no cuenta con el apoyo económico del padre.
Vive junto con su mama quien apoya en sus ventas cada día. Iniciando con poco capital y aumentando el nivel de venta al ofrecer una variedad de platillos, a si como ropa variada. Gracias a los financiamiento que Afodenic ha otorgado en cuatro ciclos.
Con este nuevo crédito será para la compra de ropa, cosmético y parte invertirá en productos de pollo, carne, verduras, frutas para seguir preparando su rica comida. lo que generara ingresos para sus gastos personales.
texts.en: Tamara is a small business owner who sells food and clothing and has built up a customer base for both.  She is a single mother of two and works very hard to provide for her children, since she has no support from their father.  She lives next door to her mother, who helps her out in her business. She started off with a little capital and slowly increased her sales by offering a variety of dishes and clothing thanks to the funding she’s received from Afodenic in four cycles.  With her new loan she will purchase more clothing, cosmetics and will use part of it to purchase beef and poultry products, vegetables, and fruit so she can continue preparing her delicious dishes, which generate income that is used for personal expenses.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her business

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es: Sebastián tiene 31 años, su actividad es una barbería ya que hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio. El es un hombre muy trabajador y disfruta con este negocio la variedad de de sus clientes, el tiene que levantarse temprano desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde pues afluencia de clientes empieza circular muy temprano por las calles. El motivo de este financiamiento es para la compra de peines, navajas, tijeras, talcos, entre otras herramientas.
texts.en: Sebastian is 31 years old and for over two years has owned a barber shop. He is a very hard-working man and enjoys his business and working with a variety of clients.  He is up and running from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening, as his clients start coming in very early.  This loan will be used to purchase combs, razor, scissors, talcum powder and other barbering tools.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: the purchase of calving cows

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, de 42 años, es una mujer soltera y trabajadora, que vive en compañía de su mamá Julia, de 76 años, a la que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. El trabajo de Marcelina, es la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de comestibles, donde todas las mañanas desde muy temprano abre sus puertas para comercializarlos  a los pobladores de su localidad; pero como ella es una mujer muy activa, por la tarde se dirige a sus cultivos de papa, maíz y arveja, los cuales cuida desde hace ya 20 años, donde pudo aprender no solo las técnicas de cultivo, también a comercializar a buen precio sus cosechas en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Pero el pasatiempo de ella es cuidar de sus animales entre vacas y carneros. Ahora Marcelina, desea aumentar la cantidad de animales que posee para poder incursionar en la elaboración de queso. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, y se siente orgullosa de pertenecer a su banco comunal, donde sus integrantes son personas integras y sobre todo responsables. De obtener el crédito solicitado, planea invertir en la compra de 5 bolsas de semilla de arveja, que oscilan entre los 550 soles cada uno.
texts.en: Marcelina, age 42, is a single and hard-working woman who lives with her mother Julia, age 76. She cares for her mother in her own home in the Cumutay hamlet. Marcelina sells basic needs products in her food store, where she opens her doors very early every morning to sell to the residents of the area. Since she is a very actie woman, she cares for her potato, corn and bean crops in the afternoon. She has been doing this for 20 years, and she has learned not only the cultivation techniques, but also how to sell her harvests at a good price in the wholesale market of her city. Her pass-time is caring for her animals, cows and sheep. Marcelina wants to increase the amount of animals that she has in order to start making cheese. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and she is proud to belong to her community bank, where the members are upright and responsible. When she obtains this loan, she will invest in the purchase of 5 bags of pea seeds, which cost approximately 550 soles each.

loans.use: to purchase 5 bags of pea seeds.

loans.name: Alexandra Dolores

texts.es:
Alexandra de 31 años, es una joven emprendedora que está trabajando vendiendo productos Yanbal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes) para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. 

Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso y trabaja sola vendiendo los productos a sus vecinos, conocidos y recorriendo las calles. Vende productos como perfumes, cremas, maquillaje, desodorantes a un precio muy cómodo para sus clientes incluso les da los productos con un plazo de pagos por cuotas. 

Quiere seguir ayudando a su esposo por eso quiere continuar vendiendo los productos Yanbal por eso necesita comprar con el préstamo perfumes, cremas, desodorantes etc. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa ya que ahora es de caña y ladrillos.
texts.en: Alexandra, age 31, is an enterprising youth who works selling Yanbal products (Yanbal is a company that offers enterprising women a chance to start selling independently) to help her husband with the household costs. She lives in a periurban zone called Pariaso, and she works alone selling those products to her neighbours and acquaintances, and on the street. She sells products such as perfumes, creams, makeup and deodorants at a price that is very comfortable for her clients. She also offers products with a payment plan. She wants to continue helping her husband, so she wants to continue selling Yanbal products. Thus she needs to use the loan to buy perfumes, creams, deodorants, etc. In the future, she wants to finish building her home, as it is currently made of logs and bricks.

loans.use: perfumes, creams, deodorants

loans.name: Luisa Elizabeth

texts.es:
Luisa de 52 años, siempre quiso darle una buena vida a sus 4 hijos pero cuando se quedo sin trabajo su esposo ellos comenzaron a gastar sus ahorros y ella decidió comprar un pequeño terreno para ubicar una pequeña tienda. 

Con esfuerzo y dedicación ha trabajado en una zona urbana llamada suburbio donde tiene ubicada la tienda y la pequeña papelería. En la actualidad realiza las comprar junto a su esposo en el mercado desde las 06h00am y comienza la atención al público a las 06h45am hasta las 22h00pm. Vende víveres como bebidas, snack, arroz y algunos artículos de papelería.  

Tiene muchas aspiración con su tienda- papelería por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo bisutería, papelería, cuadernos, plumas etc. En el futuro quiere mantener una familia unida y continuar ampliando su negocio.
texts.en: Luisa, age 52, has always wanted to give her 4 children a good life, but when her husband lost his job they started spending their savings and she decided to buy a small plot of land to open a small store. With hard work and dedication she has worked in an urban zone called Suburbio where she has her store and a small stationery store. She currently makes her purchases with her husband in the market at 6:00 am, and the store is open to the public from 6:45 am til 10:00 pm. She sells groceries such as drinks, snacks and rice, and other stationery items. She has many dreams for her store/stationery store, and so she wants to use the loan to buy costume jewelry, notebooks, pens etc. In the future she wants to keep her family together and continue to expand her business.

loans.use: stationery, costume jewelry, notebooks

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, D. 58 años, enviudo hace 2 años, y confiesa que aún se siente triste por ello, pero el apoyo constante que recibe D. sus 3 hijos, la motiva. Ella vive sola en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad D. San Ramón (selva central peruana). La alegría que muestra está mujer es reflejo del constante apoyo que recibe D. parte D. sus hijos, los que construyeron sus casas alrededor D. ella para poder cuidarla. El trabajo al que se dedica Elena, es la venta D. comestibles, verduras y frutas, los cuales venD. en un pequeño espacio que acondicionó en su casa. Ya tiene 4 años dedicándose a esto, pero como exitosa mujer cuenta, que no solo a ello se dedica, pues tiene un negocio D. venta D. café y  miel, productos que lo consigue en la ciudad D. Perene, donD. viaja constantemente, para luego comercializarlo en la capital del país. Pero las fuerzas D. Elena, es sorprendente, ya que también siembra papa en la ciudad D. Tarma, donD. viaja en cada cosecha. Sin embargo es conciente D. su avanzada edad, por ello desea comprar una máquina D. tejer chompas D. lana, los cuales piensa vender en la ciudad D. Huancayo y La Oroya. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, y se siente feliz D. pertenecer a su banco comunal, que según sus propias palabras “son como su familia”. D. adquirir el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. insumos necesarios para invertirlo en su tienda D. abarrotes, y si el dinero le alcanza invertirá en su próxima siembra D. papa.
texts.en: 58-year-old Elena is a widow of two years. She is still sad about his death, but the constant support she receives from her 3 children motivates her. She lives alone in her own home in the city of San Ramón (in the central Peruvian rainforest). The happiness she shows is a reflection of the support she receives from her children, who built their houses around her so they could look after her. Elena makes a living selling food, vegetables and fruits, from a little space set up in her home. She has been at this business for 4 years, but as this successful woman tells us, she also has a business selling coffee and honey. She gets these products in the city of Perene, where she travels constantly, and then sells them in the country’s capital. Elena’s strengths are surprising because she also grows potatoes in the city of Tarma, where she travels every harvest season. She is, however, aware of her advanced age, which is why she would like to buy a knitting machine to make sweaters to sell in the city of Huancayo and La Oroya. This is her eighth MFP loan, and she is happy belonging to her communal bank, which, in her own words, “is like family.” Once she gets the requested loan, she will use it to buy supplies for her grocery shop and if she makes any extra money she will spend it on growing potatoes.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery items and to invest in growing potatoes

loans.name: Sergio Antonio

texts.es:
Sergio de 37 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, vive con su madre, es soltero y no tiene hijos, se dedica a la venta de medicina y ropa, este negocio inicio por idea de él viéndose en la necesidad de dedicarse a un negocio productivo que le generara ingresos.
Por el momento Sergio no cuenta con suficiente mercadería y solicita un préstamo para la compra de prendas de vestir y medicamentos, este préstamo  le ayudara a realizar la inversión y le dará una mayor capacidad al negocio para atender a la clientela.
El quiere prosperar en el comercio y adquirir experiencia que le lleve a ser un vendedor mayorista, además de formar su familia y velar por su bienestar.
texts.en:
Sergio is 37 years old and lives with his mother in San Rafael Oriente, located in the department of San Miguel. He is single with no children and works selling medicine and clothing. It was his idea to start this business because of the need to work in a productive business that would generate income for him.

At this time, Sergio does not have enough merchandise and is requesting a loan for the purchase of clothing and medicines. This loan will help him to make the investment and will provide him with a greater capacity to attend to his customers.

He wants to prosper in his business and gain experience that will help him be a wholesale vendor, in addition to forming his family and watching out for their well-being.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor de 25 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de Usulután, donde vive con sus padres, es soltero, todos en su casa trabajan y él se dedica a la venta de medicina, sus ventas las realiza de forma ambulante, todos los días de la semana, ya tiene establecidas sus rutas y clientes que visitar.
El necesita comprar más mercadería para vender, por lo que solicita un préstamo para realizar esta inversión, comprando medicamentos distintos, teniendo un negocio más fuerte y prospero.
Su objetivo es ser un vendedor mayorista, atender toda la zona y ampliarse con empleados, realizar también una buena inversión con este préstamo y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Victor is 25 years old and lives with his parents in San Rafael Oriente, located in the department of Usulután. He is single and everyone in his house works. He works selling medicine and he makes his sales everyday on foot. Victor already has his established routes and customers that he visits. He needs to purchase more merchandise to sell, which is why he is requesting a loan to make this investment, purchasing different medicines to have a stronger and more prosperous business.

His goal is to be a wholesale vendor, serving the entire zone and expanding the business with employees. He also wants to make a good investment with this loan and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase medicines

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna es  una pequeña comerciante, con su propio negocio que inicio hace ocho años, primeramente inicio con poca mercadería dinero que provino de su trabajo anterior en sastrería, y ahorro que su esposo dio.

 Ahora hoy en día, con AFODENIC sus niveles de venta aumentaron al ofrecer más variedad en sus mercaderías con precios más competitivos. Ya que atreves del financiamiento pudo lograr el objetivo de captar clientes.

Con este nuevo crédito invertirá en productos de consumo en granos básicos quintales de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, bidón de aceite, caja de jabón, cereales, golosinas, productos lácteos y cosméticos.  Lo que espera seguir aumentando su nivel de ventas para bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Reyna is a small merchant with her own business that she started eight years ago. She initially began with little merchandise and money that came from her previous job as a tailor, as well as savings that her husband gave her.

Now, with AFODENIC, her sales levels increased upon offering more varied merchandise at more competitive prices because through the loan, she was able to achieve her goal of attracting customers.

With this new loan, she will invest in groceries such as basic grains, 100-pound bags of rice, beans, sugar, corn, cans of oil, boxes of soap, cereals, sweets, dairy products, and cosmetics. What she hopes is to continue increasing her level of sales for her family’s well-being.

loans.use: To invest in basic grains and cosmetics, increasing sales for higher income

loans.name: José Neftali

texts.es:
José de 39 años de edad, reside en Perquin departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 8 años de edad, posee una tienda la cual administra desde hace 10 años además de tener un molino, trabaja toda la semana atendiendo la tienda y el molino.
José posee un vehículo que por el momento tiene desperfectos por lo que solicita un préstamo para realizar la debida inspección del mecánico y proceda a la reparación, este préstamo ayudara a que mantenga en buenas condiciones el carro que le sirve para transportar la mercadería para el negocio.
El sueño de él es proveer a su familia lo necesario, cubrir las necesidades básicas y ayudar a su hijo en los estudios para que sea un profesional en el futuro.
texts.en:
José is 39 years old and lives with his wife and 8-year-old son in Perquín, located in the department of Morazán. He has a store which he has run for 10 years, in addition to having a mill. He works through the entire week attending to the store and the mill.

José has a vehicle which has damages at the moment. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to complete the needed mechanical inspection and to repair the vehicle. This loan will help to keep the car that he uses to transport his business’ merchandise in good condition.

His dream is to provide his family with what is needed, covering the basic needs and helping his son with school so that he will be a professional in the future.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 53 años D. edad, resiD. en Guatajiagua departamento D. Morazán, donD. vive con su esposo don Ángel y sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. comales, tiene más D. 20 años dedicándose a este oficio, su madre fue quien le enseño a trabajar con barro, hoy su horario normal es D. 8:00am a 5:00pm.
Actualmente ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. materia prima como barro, semillas D. nacazcol y loza cruda, con este préstamo otorgado tendrá acceso a la compra D. material y favorecerá su inventario para continuar en su oficio que por años le ha dado a su familia los ingresos para solventar diferentes situaciones.
Su propósito es cancelar este préstamo puntualmente, aumentar su producción D. ollas y comales, además D. aumentar también sus ingresos para poder algún día construir su casa y ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
María is 53 years old and lives with her husband, Ángel, and four children in Guatajiagua, located in the department of Morazán. She works making and selling comales (smooth, flat griddles maD. for cooking tortillas) and has been in this traD. for more than 20 years. Her mother was the one who taught her to work with clay. Today, her normal schedule is from 8am to 5pm.

She is currently requesting a loan for the purchase of raw materials such as clay, nacazcol seeds (used for dye), and unfired earthenware. With the loan granted, she will be able to purchase material that will benefit her inventory in order to continue in the traD. that has provided her family with income to cover different situations for years.

Her intention is to pay off the loan on time, to increase her production of pots and comales, as well as to increase her income so that she can one day build her house and help her children in their studies.

loans.use: To purchase materials: clay, nacazcol seeds, and unfired earthenware

loans.name: Carmen Noemy

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 30 años de edad, reside en Chilanga departamento de Morazán, es soltera y vive en casa con sus padres, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 6 años, visita casa por casa ofreciendo la ropa por el momento lo hace los días sábados y domingos, ya que de lunes a viernes trabaja como cocinera en un comedor.
Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene además del trabajo en el comedor, por eso ella quiere invertir en ropa para ir aumentando poco a poco y para hacerlo solicita un préstamo que invertirá en pantalones, camisas y ropa interior, este préstamo le ayudara a fortalecer la venta y a la oportunidad de ganar más clientes y aumentar sus ingresos.
El objetivo de ella es generar ingresos para mejorar  la vivienda de sus padres y que estos se sientan más seguros y en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Carmen is 30 years old.  She lives in Chilanga, in Morazán Department.  She is single and lives at home with her parents.

For six years Carmen has sold clothes.  She goes from house to house offering the clothes, but for the moment she does this on Saturdays and Sundays, since she works Monday through Friday as a cook at a cafeteria.

This business is Carmen's source of income besides the job at the cafeteria.  For this reason she wants to invest in clothing to expand her business little by little.  To do it she is asking for a loan that she will invest in pants, shirts and underwear.  This loan will help her to strengthen her sales and give her the opportunity to gain more customers and increase her earnings.

Carmen's goal is to earn income to improve her parents' house so they feel safer and have better living conditions.

loans.use: Buy pants, shirts and underwear

loans.name: Yulima

texts.es: La señora Yulima S. C. tiene 40 años y vive con su esposo y su único hijo varón de 18 años en el barrio Lucero de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Ella tiene una tienda en la cual vende toda clase de víveres. El negocio era de su padre quien es actualmente pensionado de la policía nacional. Sus padres son oriundos del departamento del Tolima, en el centro del País y se trasladaron a la costa hace más de treinta años. La microempresaria desde niña ha estado vinculada al negocio de tienda. Su jornada laboral comienza a las 6 A.M. y termina a las 10 P.M. En horas de la noche, el esposo de la señora Yulima, que trabaja como mensajero, le colabora en atender los clientes. Este es el segundo crédito que ella tramita en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea utilizarlo en financiar la matrícula de su hijo en un instituto de educación técnica. El joven cursará cuarto semestre de electrónica. El promedio de ventas diarias es de $ 150.000 COP y el margen de utilidad es del 18%. Los fines de semana las ventas aumentan considerablemente porque la microempresaria coloca varias mesas y sillas en la terraza del negocio para que los vecinos del sector jueguen dominó y parqué mientras escuchan música y degustan una fría cerveza. La señora Yulima dice conocer tanto a sus clientes que casi siempre acierta en adivinar qué van a comprar.
texts.en:
Yulima S. C. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and 18 year-old son in Lucero neighborhood, in the city of Barranquilla.  She has a store where she sells all sorts of foodstuffs.  The business was her father's.  Her father is currently retired from the National Police Force.  Her parents are originally from Tolima department, in the center of the country.  They moved to the coast more than thirty years ago.

This small businesswoman has been linked to the store since she was a young girl.  Her work day starts at 6.00am and ends at 10.00pm.  During the evening hours Yulima's husband, who works as a messenger, helps her to serve her customers.

This is the second loan that Yulima has taken from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to use it to pay her son's registration fee for technical college.  The young man will be entering his fourth semester of an electronics course.

Yulima's average daily sales amount to 150,000 Colombian pesos and her profit margin is 18%.  On weekends, her sales increase considerably because she puts some tables and chairs outside her business where neighbors can sit and play dominoes and parcheesi while they listen to music and enjoy a cold beer.  Yulima says that she knows her customers so well that she can nearly always guess correctly what they are going to buy.

loans.use: To pay her son's registration fee for technical college

loans.name: Elsa Guadalupe

texts.es: La Sra. Elsa es una persona que hace algún tiempo tuvo in problema fuerte de salud y a raíz de eso decidió cuando se recupero poner un negocio de artículos para regalo debido a que le fue muy bien, empezó a vender calzado y con las ganancias fue agrandando su negocio y así ala vez ayudando a su esposo a la economía del hogar y su mayor satisfacción es que sus hijas no tuvieron que dejar sus estudios ya que con lo que ella y su esposo aportan han logrado salir adelante y su crédito lo utilizara para la compra de mercancía de temporada y así agrandar su negocio .
texts.en: Elsa is a person who had a really bad health problem some time ago.  As a result of this, she decided that when she got better she would set up a business selling gifts.  As this went very well, she started to sell footwear too.  She used her profits to expand her business and help her husband with their household finances.  Her biggest satisfaction is that her daughters have been able to continue with their studies because, with the money both she and her husband have provided, they have managed to get ahead in life.  She will use her loan to buy seasonal merchandise and thereby expand her business.

loans.use: To stock her business with merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marcos Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marcos, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos tiene 29 años de edad, su familia está conformada por dos hijas de 14 años y 2 ½ años de edad, su hija mayor estudia secundaria, ella es madre soltera y vive junto a sus hijas alquilando un cuarto en un mesón, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y prendas de vestir en el mercado municipal.
El negocio es atendido todos los días de 7:00am a 4:00pm, desde hace tres años, sus dificultades son la escases de recursos para la inversión y la competencia  de otros puestos mayores; Marcos se ha motivado a solicitar un préstamo en esta ocasión para la compra de mercadería (ganchos para el cabello, cosméticos, ropa interior) esta inversión le ayudara muchísimo para surtir el negocio, además de atender mejor a los clientes ofreciéndoles gran variedad de productos.
Su mayor sueño es lograr algún día construir su propia casa, ayudar a sus hijas con el estudio para que están puedan finalizar bien este proceso, aunque en la actualidad sus propósitos son generar ingresos para poder subsistir mediante las ventas del negocio.
texts.en:
Marcos lives in San Francisco Gotera, in Morazán Department.  She sells cosmetics, and she is 29 years old.  Her family is made up of her two daughters, ages 14 and 2 ½.  Her elder daughter attends high school.  Marcos is a single mother and lives with her daughters in a rented room at an inn.  She sells cosmetics and clothing at the town market.

The business is run daily from 7:00am to 4:00pm and has been for three years.  Her problems are scarce resources for investment and competition from bigger places.  On this occasion, Marcos was motivated to ask for a loan to buy merchandise (hairpins, cosmetics and underwear).  This investment will help her a great deal in stocking the business, as well as serving her customers better by offering them a large variety of products.

Her biggest dream is to someday be able to build her own house and help her daughters with their studies so they can do well, although currently her goal is to earn income so she can live off of her business's sales.

loans.use: Buy merchandise (hairpins, cosmetics, underwear)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Los Alcatraces De Peña Group

texts.es: Este grupo decidió ponerse el nombre de Los Alcatraces de Peña ya que todas ellas coinciden en que los  alcatraces son muy bellos y se identifican con ellos, y de peña por que viven en Monte de Peña.  Maria S. G. es la tesorera del grupo tiene 42 años de edad,es casada y tiene dos hijos: uno de 9 y otro de 19 años de edad, desde hace 22 años se dedica ala fabricación de bolsas, mochilas y maletas. En su domicilio tiene un cuartito donde guarda sus máquinas de coser y material para la elaboración de las mochilas; ella solicita un crédito para acondicionar un espacio para su taller de costura, donde pueda colocar más maquinas y asi aumentar su producción.  Con la ganancia obtenida tiene pensado terminar de poner piso firme en su casa y comprar ropa para sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group decided to call themselves Los Alcatraces de Peña (The Lilies of Peña) because they all agree that calla lilies ("alcatraces") are beautiful and the women identify with them.  They added "de Peña" because they live in Monte de Peña.

Maria S. G. is the group's treasurer.  She is 42 years old, married, and has two children: one is 9 years old and the other is 19.  For 22 years she has made bags, backpacks and suitcases.  She has a little room in her house where she keeps her sewing machines and the material for making the backpacks.  Maria is asking for a loan to set up a space for her sewing workshop where she can put more machines and therefore increase her production.  She is thinking about using the extra earnings to finish putting flooring in her house and to buy clothes for her children.

loans.use: Construction materials for sewing workshop

loans.name: Sue

texts.en:
Sue U. is 35 years of age and married with five children between 10 and 22. She has a business selling lavalavas — bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women.  She has two years experience in this business. Sue needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use her profits — estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week — to improve and expand her business.

In 2009, Sue joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Sue 's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Audrey

texts.en:
Audrey J. created Visions CPR, First Aid & EMT Training because she wanted to provide excellent training for medical professionals. Audrey has been working in the medical sector for over 30 years. She was originally a medic in the Army and then began training others in 1986. Her passion for teaching led her to open her own training center to ensure students receive top quality courses.  

The Visions CPR courses give medical professionals the skills to save lives. Audrey’s loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana was used to replace old equipment, to pay three months’ rent on the facility, and to put money aside to pay instructors. There are many companies that offer training in the industry, so Audrey has to make Visions CPR stand out. She does this by buying state of the art equipment and by hiring professional paramedics to teach classes. The professional paramedics give her clients “off the books” knowledge that they may not receive at other training centers.

Audrey opened her business in 2006 and has been working to improve it since then. Her advice to people opening new businesses is to find the best ways to advertise because advertising can be difficult. She also wants to tell new entrepreneurs that starting a business is not easy. She says, “You have to have a desire to do what you’re doing.” Audrey has proven that being patient and diligent, despite setbacks, will help a business succeed. She looks forward to continuing to provide medical professionals with the courses they need.  

Feel free to check out her website: www.visionscpr.com.

loans.use: To buy new equipment, pay three months' rent and salaries for teachers

loans.name: El Milagro Oli Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO SE LLAMA EL MILAGRO DE OLI, DADO QUE FUE UN MILAGRO QUE EL GRUPO SE ARMARA. LA SEÑORA CARMEN C. ES TESORERA DEL GRUPO QUE ESTÁ UBICADO EN JILOTEPEC, ESTADO DE MÉXICO. ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACIÓN DE CRUCES Y FIGURAS DE MARMOL, LA SEÑORA TIENE 38 AÑOS Y 4 HIJOS, TODOS SON VARONES. ELLA LLEVA 1 AÑO TRABAJANDO CON CREDICOMUN Y SE SIENTE MUY ENTUSIASMADA PORQUE EL CREDITO LE HA AYUDADO A FORTALECER SU NEGOCIO. EN ESTA OCASIÓN LO QUIERE PARA COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA Y CON LAS GANANCIAS  MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE SU PRODUCTO Y POR LO TANTO DE SU VIDA.
texts.en: This group is called El Milagro de Oli (Oli's Miracle) because it was a miracle that the group got together. Carmen C. is the treasurer of this group, which is located in Jilotepec in the State of Mexico.  She makes crosses and figures of marble.  She is 38 years old and has four sons.  Carmen has been working with CrediComun for one year, and she is very excited because the loan has helped her to strengthen her business.  This time she wants the loan so she can buy raw materials and use her earnings to improve the quality of her products and therefore of her life.

loans.use: Raw materials

loans.name: Faifua

texts.en:
Faifua L. is 37 and married with four children between two and 15. She has had a business selling baked goods for the past three years and  needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make baked goods for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business —estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week — to improve and expand her business.

In 2009, Faifua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Faifua's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Moana

texts.en:
Moana T. is 52 and married with 5 children between 10 and 24. She owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale and has three years experience in this business. Moana needs a loan of WST$1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business — estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week — to improve and expand the business.

Moana joined SPBD in 2009 and this is her second loan. SPBD's loans are Moana's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Nora Elia

texts.es: La Sra. Nora desea agrandar su negocio pues ella empezó con la venta en sus días de descanso luego los fines de semana y ponía a la venta la ropa que ya no le quedaba a sus hijos  luego vio que el negocio era rentable y empezó a comprar al menudeo en otras parte y ve en el crédito la oportunidad de agrandar su negocio y mejorar su ingreso familiar pues desea poner ropa de temporada
texts.en:
Nora wants to expand her business.  She started selling on her days off, and then on the week-ends.  She sold the clothes that no longer fit her children.  Then, she saw that the business was profitable, and she started to buy retail in other places. 

She sees the loan as the opportunity to expand her business and improve the family income.

She wishes to invest in seasonal clothing.

loans.use: To buy used clothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tasi

texts.en:
Tasi R. is 56 and married with six children between 15 and 28. She owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale and has four years of experience. Tasi needs a loan of WST$3900 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business —estimated to be 800 talas or US $350 per week — to improve and expand the business.

Tasi joined SPBD in 2006 and this is her seventh loan. SPBD's loans are Tasi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Maima

texts.en:
Maima Fegaui is 27 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. Maima has 2 years of experience in this business. Maima needs a loan of 1500 WST to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Maima joined SPBD. This is her second loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Maima's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Faimafili

texts.en:
Faimafili L. is 35 and married with 2 children. She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. Faimafili has 2 years of experience in this business. Faimafili needs a loan of 1000 WST to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Faimafili joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Faimafili's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Fereni

texts.en:
Fereni E. is 45 and married with 5 children. She owns a business venture selling cold drinks in the local communities. Fereni has 2 years of experience in this business. Fereni needs a loan of 1000 WST to purchase raw ingredients such as sugar, flavored drinks and foam cups to produce ice-cake for sale. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Fereni joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Fereni's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es: Mirtha, de 43 años, está casada con Erwin, de 48 años. Ambos tiene 2 hijos: Isabel, de 21 y Edwin, de 12 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de San Ramón (selva central peruana). Su alegría es notoria, ya que ella hace 10 años comenzó con la apertura de una tienda de comestibles, donde vende bebidas como cerveza, gaseosa, helados, y demás productos de primera necesidad, los cuales en todo este tiempo le proporcionaron buenas ganancias, tanto así que ahora en sociedad con su hija Isabel, comenzaron a incursionar en la apertura de un salón de belleza, en un lugar céntrico de la ciudad donde está segura le irá muy bien. Ahora Mirtha está pensando implementar su negocio con la compra de equipos de última generación para poder mantenerse las expectativas de sus clientes y crecer en el tiempo. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, y como socia de su banco comunal se siente feliz de poder integrar una asociación unida y sin mayores complicaciones. De obtener el crédito, podrá invertir en la compra de un mostrador de vidrio para su salón de belleza, que cuesta un promedio de S/. 680.00 nuevos soles, y el resto del dinero lo invertirá pen la compra de insumos necesarios para comenzar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mirtha, 43, is married to Erwin, 48.  They have two children:  Isabel, 21, and Edwin, 12.  The family lives in their own house, located in the city of San Ramón (in Peru's central jungle).

Mirtha is well-known for her happiness.  10 years ago she opened a grocery store, where she sold beer, soft drinks, ice cream and other staple goods.  The store gave her such a good income that now, with her daughter Isabel, she has begun to invest in opening a beauty salon in a central location in the city where she is sure she will do well.  Now Mirtha is thinking about supplying her business by purchasing the most modern equipment to meet her customers' expectations and grow with time.

This is her eighth loan with MFP, and as a member of her communal bank she is happy to be able to join such a united association that has no major problems.  When she receives the loan, she will be able to purchase for her beauty salon a glass counter, which costs on average 680 new soles.  Mirtha will invest the rest of the money in necessary supplies for starting the business.

loans.use: Buy a counter and materials for her beauty salon

loans.name: Soo

texts.en:
Soo F. is 48 and married with 6 children. She owns a business venture selling fried foods in the local community. Soo has 2 years of experience in this business. Soo needs a loan of 1000 WST to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food such as soy-sauce, tomato sauce, mutton flaps, chicken leg quarter, onions and rice. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Soo joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Soo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale
